updates.update_content:
Good morning here is our new live project!

Five entire teams dedicated to the game of Fantasy Football!

Many small and evil little creatures will battle on the playing field!

Good evening!!!

Our kickstarter has ended with a great success.
We thank you all for your contributions.

We are already working on creating the presupposed files in both .stl and chitubox versions.

We are in the final stages of this beautiful but exhausting kickstarter.

We've added a lot of add-ons, which we remind you are free for all "i want it all" pledges.
But we are not stopping yet, even today we add a sculpture for you!
Another of the most famous fairy tales in the world, and unfortunately also one of the saddest, the little match girl.

only three days until the end of this campaign.

But we still won't stop sculpting for you and adding miniatures for you!

Also today a small gift from us.

was perhaps one of the most requested and needed updates.

And finally here it is for you, all our princesses (but not only) without weapons.

Ideal for making a team of amazons for fantasy football!

We're a week away from the end of this campaign, but still more sculptures are on the way.

Not all of your suggestions will be able to be implemented, that would be impossible.
But we will try to make as many as possible.

We are approaching the final stages.

But we still have time to give you some add-ons

Today we made this Big Bad Wolf interpreting it in our way!

Today is Sunday and we opted to create a very simple new add-on and rest a bit.

We have created just this bleacher which can be used with the other components of the castle to create a nice fantasy football stadium.

Good morning!

Also today a new sculpture for you!
We are spoiling you!

campaign.story:
Introducing a precisely digitally hand-recreated reproduction of the next Cotta's almanac deck full of history, and for the fourth time, strongly touched by Schiller's works, continuing after the previous yellow, green, and the blue one, which was the first published complete transformation playing card deck in the world!
The red "Turandot" deck is the fourth in a series of six famous transformation playing card decks we plan to release... This fourth Cotta's almanac playing cards deck was originally published in 1809. There is no known evidence of any deck issued in 1808, and so this red almanac issued in 1809 is considered to be the fourth in a series.
Court card figures depict Arabs in various costumes, which could have been taken from sources of the seven climes (Persia, China/Turkestan, Khwârazm, Slavonia, North Africa, Byzantium, and India), which as well adds another historical value to its rarity. 
Additionally to the series of Cotta's almanac decks, all influenced by notable authors, this one might also draw on aspects from another Schiller's work - especially the translation and his intriguing epic symbolic adaptation of Turandot, the famous commedia dell'arte (Italian comedy) play by Count Carlo Gozzi from 1762 after and originated in supposedly Persian story of Calaf's adventure in the theme of the Arabic and Persian tales from the collection (Thousand and One Day) Les Mille et un jours (1710–1712) by François Pétis de la Croix.   
The artwork also may have been inspired by the Arab population that migrated to Germany or even studied in Tübingen where the Cotta's publishing house was founded. But mostly there was a friendship between Schiller, Goethe, Cotta, and Gozzi, who died in 1806, a year after Schiller in 1805, what might have been the true impulse.
"Numbered" Limited Edition Displayed (Whole Metallic Gold-Inked Tuck)
Features:
Printed by USPCC on Classic Stock
Poker Size
Embossed (Linen) Finish 
52 Cards + 2 Extra 17th-century Jokers + 2 Extra Collectible 16th-century Art Cards 
Metallic Ink On Box & Card Backs (Both Versions of Tucks and Card Backs inside) 
Custom Seals - Numbered and Standard 
Puzzle Image on all Tuck Spines of the Series (Inking Vary by Tuck Version) 
Digitally Hand-Recreated and Designed by Azured Ox
Produced By Will Roya
After the success of the first blue 1805, the second green 1806, and the third yellow 1807 Cotta's almanac decks, again we come with two versions of the fourth red 1809 Cotta's deck limited edition - the "Numbered" and the "Standard".
As campaigns before, we are limiting this 4th "Numbered" deck to only 1,000 copies of tuck which is the whole gold-inked with custom numbered seals. Additional "Standard" limited edition decks are created just with a slight difference on tuck designed with dark and gold ink combination and the same custom seals (non-numbered). Both versions will include the same gold metallic inked card back design inside of the tuck box.
There are many historical values in the series of decks...
That's why the entire 6 deck series is in many ways designed by Azured Ox to meet collector's demand as a "collection of historical books" with their mysteries and secrets hidden inside up to your findings...
Series of decks will be produced with the piece of puzzle image on each tuck "book" spine (left side of the box) to create together a nice display of the Tuebingen monument surroundings, where the idea for Cotta's decks was born.
Puzzle Spine Image "Digital Demonstration" to present Ink Combinations of Both Tuck Versions
If you are interested in more information about historical details with a profound and beautiful story behind Cotta's Almanac playing cards creation and idea, or about the famous and noble people connected to these unique transformation playing card decks, you can find reading after scrolling down this project page.
The design of both versions of Cotta's limited edition tuck boxes, the standard and the numbered, created by Azured Ox, have been inspired by the old books and published writers' work using the gold ink on their covers as well as combined with the dark ink. 
Inking and Tuck Design Inspired by Old Books
Unexplained stories, hidden mysteries, secrets...
Much of historical happenings, influences, and activities would find a place in the Cotta decks, including events in the life of Cotta's own family and notable figures like Schiller and Goethe. Other important influences include the literature, art, history, politics (e.g. Napoleon's invasion), and religious reforms of the time, which all served as an important context to shape the art in the decks themselves...
4th almanac deck: "Arabic Turandot" (Year 1809) 
After the first blue deck themed on Joan of Arc play by Schiller, the second green deck themed on Jean Racine's plays, which were translated into the German language by Schiller, and the third yellow deck themed on Wallenstein, here in the fourth red deck, again the images on the court cards might be the characters somehow connected to another Schiller's translational work (1801), the Turandot by Count Carlo Gozzi from 1762, and so those Arabs displayed on court cards might be deeply inspired by Schiller's reverse thinking about the Turandot tale's true origin, as up to the present day, this play in its variety of settlements is considered as an enigma since original ideas were mostly filtered through many versions and their translated adaptations around the world over time.
"Nizami Ganjavi" Jamal ad-Dīn Abū Muḥammad Ilyās ibn-Yūsuf ibn-Zakkī is considered the greatest romantic epic poet in Persian literature, who brought a colloquial and realistic style to the epic.
Court card figures depict Arabs in various costumes, which could have been taken from sources of the seven climes (Persia, China/Turkestan, Khwârazm, Slavonia, North Africa, Byzantium, and India), which adds another historical value to its rarity. These seven climes may stretch back into the old stories, which are eventually also linked as a source idea for Turandot anecdote - Persian masterpiece Seven Beauties, by the Persian "wisdom" poet Nezami (died 1209) who recounts the romantic history of the pre-Islamic Persian king Bahram. The story of his journey from "black to white" also refers to Bahram’s spiritual development from darkness and ignorance to light and illumination, uniting himself with the source of light. He grows to a Perfect Man and an ideal king.
The plot of this story is very complex but significantly filled with mathematical, astronomical, cosmogonic, medical, spiritual, and mystical symbolism, which is surely interesting background for playing cards and their purposely hidden deep meanings...
And why Arabs? Turandot = Turan's daughter 
(The name derives from the Persian compound name Turan and dokht, meaning the daughter of Turan. Dokht is a shortened form of dokhtar or "daughter", "girl". As Persian belongs to the Indo-European family of languages, the word dokhtar has cognates in European languages. Turan refers to the northeastern borders of Persia. Turandot recounts the story of a Turkestan/Chinese princess who kills her suitors when they fail to decipher riddles.)
Additionally to the series of Cotta's almanac decks, all influenced by notable authors and works, it is more than likely, just by continuing pattern, that even this 4th red deck might also draw on aspects from another Schiller's work - especially as mentioned above, the Schiller's translation and his intriguing epic symbolic adaptation of Turandot, the famous commedia dell'arte (Italian comedy) play by Count Carlo Gozzi from 1762 after and originated in supposedly Persian story of Calaf's adventure in the theme of the Arabic and Persian tales from the collection (Thousand and One Day) Les Mille et un jours (1710–1712) translated from Persian original by François Pétis de la Croix.
Count Carlo Gozzi (13 December 1720 – 4 April 1806)
There is also evidence of the first theatre premiere of Schiller's adaptation of Turandot in 1802, specifically at the "old" Weimar Hoftheater by Johann von Goethe, who had been the theatre's director since its inception in 1791. Schiller had begun a collaborative friendship with Goethe in 1794 which lasted until Schiller's death in 1805, after which Goethe forsook ballads and turned to the completion of Part one of Faust, as well as the Cotta's almanac deck series, started in 1805, marked and influenced by these significant occurrences, and then even Gozzi's death came about a year after in 1806, and this deck's theme might be the tribute to Gozzi.
(If you are interested in more info about Schiller, Goethe, and Cotta's relation to this series of Cotta's decks, you might scroll down to read in the part of "Story About".)
"Réba Roi Arabe" (Lettered on King of Spades Court Card)
It's not all just about Schiller's famous works...
As the first blue and the second green and the third yellow deck before, also this fourth red deck was threaded by majestic and noble roots... Besides the noble publisher of the deck, Johann Friedrich Cotta, again there was another person involved in the graphical part of this deck creation.
Johann Friedrich Cotta (April 27, 1764 - December 29, 1832)
For the fourth time, again, cards were designed and stipple engraved by Countess Mary Day von Jennison-Walworth (sometimes spelled with a single 'n'). Her maiden name was Beauclerk, and she was the wife of Count Francis Jenison Walworth (1764–1824).
Probably, she was creating illustrations for decks in Stuttgart as detected from letter communication addressed to her mother in Britain that contained writings about the Cotta's decks... Her mother was Lady Diana Beauclerk (née Lady Diana Spencer; other married names Diana St John, Viscountess Bolingbroke; 24 March 1734 – 1 August 1808). Also, there in those letters is a mention about her mother's health failing what later resulted in a fatality, which probably might have been the main reason for the missing Cotta's almanac deck right for the year 1808 of the series. 
Six Unique Different Card Back Patterns Designed, with Regard to Card Handling, Individually for Each of the Cotta's Deck Year Almanacs.
Classic Style Borderless Full-Bleed Card Back Design with Luxury Feeling and Metallic Ink
The Same Gold Metallic Ink Card Back Design for Both Editions of the Cotta's Deck
Aces
Spades
Diamonds
Clubs
Hearts
In contrast to previous Cotta's decks' issues where the court cards were designated with the words "Valet", "Dame", and "Roi", which are the French terms corresponding to the Jack, Queen, and King, here the court cards of this 4th issue, Jack and Queen are not described, only King is described as "Roi".
Among all courts, the only single named figure of King Réba, the Midianite King of East, is represented as the King of Spades.
Jack of Spades - African
Queen of Spades - Noblewoman 
King of Spades - King Reba*
*Reba was one of five Midianite kings (Eʹvi, Reʹkem, Zur, Hur, and Reʹba) killed during the time of Moses by an Israelite expedition led by Phinehas, who was the grandson of Aaron (the elder brother of Moses) and the son of priest Eleazar (nephew of Moses), according to Numbers 31:8 and Joshua 13:21.
Jack of Hearts - Merchant 
Queen of Hearts - Noblewoman in ordinary home dress 
King of Hearts - Regalia Nobleman
Jack of Clubs - Ordinary man 
Queen of Clubs - Countrywoman 
King of Clubs - African
Jack of Diamonds - Infantryman 
Queen of Diamonds - Maiden in summer dress 
King of Diamonds - Nobleman
At last, we came with an idea to reflect the opposite of noble life and to bring closer to you even more of the unique artistic history placed on extra collectible playing cards...
Also, we thought it could be interesting to put other illustrations from the far past on the additional extra cards, in respect to year almanacs, we came with an idea of twelve calendar months in the series as an exclusive collection of unique historical artworks...
With the Elements of Heraldic Achievement...
Includes heraldry symbols connected with the family and past of the noble designer countess Jenison von Walworth who created most of the Cotta's decks...
An absolutely original playing card masterpiece to hang on your wall (double-sided)
EARLY BIRD:
"RED" #4 Cotta's Almanac Deck Rewards: 
COMBINATION of previous STANDARD Cotta's Decks with actual "RED" #4 STANDARD Deck: 
Did you miss some of the previous decks? 
You can add some decks to your original tier pledges with no extra shipping costs. 
Standard version of the decks are $10 each and limited version are $12 each.
Please note Limited #1 is not available at this time.
You will also have the option to add-on after the campaign and add additional items such as uncuts and other items based on availability.
Click on manage your pledge and add bonus support for the desired amount; for example, if you would like to add 1 limited and 1 standard version of a deck you would add $22 to additional support.  Very important that you remember your add-on so you can add a note when you complete the reward survey. You will also have the option to add-on after the campaign.
March 19th, 2021 - April 4th, 2021
Since this 4th deck's theme might be mostly inspired by the work of Count Carlo Gozzi, Schiller's translational work on Gozzi's Turandot, and even their friendship behind, this 4th deck might have been issued as a tribute to Gozzi, who died on April 4th, 1806, a year after Schiller, so we set symbolically end date of this 4th Cotta's deck project just to this memorial event...
Charming beginning of "Karten Almanach" series
The story behind these playing cards, which probably conceal most of the world's playing card secrets, begins in Tübingen, a city in southwest Germany.
The idea behind the concept of Cotta's transformation decks was to create a series of six decks on an annual basis from 1805-1811. Each deck would focus on a different theme...
Forming a "Card Almanac" (Karten Almanach), each card in the deck would represent one of the 52 weeks in a calendar year. At the time it was popular to print various almanacs, which were special pocketbooks for the new year, and often included a short poem or quote for each week of the calendar year. It was a logical move to connect each of these 52 weeks with playing cards.
Original illustrations were fiddling artworks - manually stipple engraved & etched on copper plates
 The famous Cotta's publishing house... 
The friendship that gave birth to the idea of Cotta's transformation playing card almanac decks...
The color of each tuck box created by Azured Ox has been inspired by Goethe's experimental optic and color theory, since Goethe was an important contemporary of Cotta, along with Schiller. (Goethe's deepest immersion into colors was during Cotta's decks issuing.)

By PlayingCardDecks.com with a safe delivery guarantee and emailed tracking. International customers are responsible for any custom fees and taxes and will need to be very patient with delivery times as we are seeing some shipments take up to 4 months.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Artwork has been pre-approved by USPCC. Some small design elements may be subject to change based on backer feedback and printer recommendations.

Besides being a super backer, I have successfully completed and delivered several of my own campaigns as well as helping & collaborating with other creators.

I really enjoy the process of creating decks with the artists and working with backers to bring the decks to life. I am in a fortunate situation to be able to cover some of the costs of producing the decks but without the help of the Kickstarter community I would not be able to bring all of my projects to life. Creating these decks is a significant investment of time and money and I am grateful for any and all support.

If there are delays or issues they will be communicated and dealt with in an open manner. As always, I appreciate any feedback. You are welcome to reach out to me directly at any time and I will do my best to get back to you in a timely manner.

Back this project with confidence!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Welcome to "Beasts and Baddies" from EC3D, your one-stop shop for the fastest, easiest to print, and highly-reusable tabletop fantasy mini STLS!
This campaign was designed with a few goals in mind:

#1 - Give DMs and gamers a beautiful set of minis to cover the bases for MANY common beasts and baddies they might encounter across most games (particularly low-to-medium level ones)
#2 - Make those minis DEAD SIMPLE to print - no supports required on resin or FDM printers.
#3 - Design those minis so they can be painted fast, but detailed enough to paint to a high quality if you wish.
#4 - Make those minis resilient - aka less prone to breakage with small pieces, easy to travel with, survive drops on the floor, etc

Thus this campaign was born! Many Patreons and Kickstarters have crazy good looking sculpts of various huge bosses, or overly fragile dynamically posed monsters - but nobody is designing minis for the working DM, who wants to throw a set of monsters on the printer before work, come home and they are sitting there finished (with no print errors), slap some paint on them quick, and use them in tonight's session.
This Kickstarter is designed for every DM - regardless of what kind of fantasy game you run, what kind of printer you have, or what kind of models you are looking to fill out your ranks with, this campaign will have something for you. We have sets of all your basic monsters (orcs, goblins, gnolls, kobolds, undead, etc) plus MANY stretch goals planned out, with a backer voting to help add even more stuff to the pledge.

These minis are designed for your standard fantasy game, and are scaled ~32mm with somewhat heroic proportions. They'll look great next to your existing 3D printable figs, HeroForge, Reaper Bones, etc.
Minis are designed to print with zero slicer supports - just drop it on your build plate and print away.  Each mini is provided unbased, based on a simple flat base (for you to decorate to your own liking), and also based on a "quick release" bevelled and channeled base (for resin printing, which makes removal from the build plate easy).
In addition to carefully modeling designs to be support free, we have another advantage: I am a software engineer by trade, and developed an algorithm to help check and remove overhangs in the modeling/repair process, which leads to even easier to print minis!
This campaign is easy to understand. There is one pledge level, and it gets you everything pictured on this page! All the minis below are included with your pledge. These minis will be delivered to you as  STL files, with all the base options noted above. I've also release a ton of BASES , and am working on another free base pack for this campaign you can use to base these minis if you want more decorative bases.
As new stretch goals are unlocked, I'll add them to the list of included minis below.  There's 31 minis in the core pack, and I'm expecting to have nearly 100 minis in this campaign when all is said and done!

** PLEASE NOTE - This Kickstarter is for digital files (STLs) to make all these items on your own home 3D printer - these are not physical goods **
To see a high-res gallery of zoomable renders of each model shown, CLICK HERE
 \
HOW IT WORKS
Every $1k we hit in funding, I'll choose, at random, a current backer. That backer will pick a set in the list above, then I'll roll a d4 and whichever tier I roll will be unlocked! If I roll a tier already unlocked for a set, I'll re-roll. "Backer vote" means we'll do a 48 hr vote to unlock a mini, "Backer Pick" means that backer will choose a mini to add to the campaign (based on my discretion of course). Some minis above are single minis, other are sets of minis.

UNLOCK HISTORY

*** [NOTE - once the campaign is ended I can no longer update the renders, stretch goal graphic, or text on this page, so please refer to KS updates to see additional renders and info on pending unlocks!] ***
Everybody loves free stuff, right?! EC3D has many many awesome minis over the years, and we remastered some from past campaigns to include as bonus items for this campaign - all backers will also receive the minis listed below, and I might add more during the campaign:
My name is Evan Carothers, and I am a 3D designer with hundreds of designs released via Thingiverse (ecaroth) and through my premium design company (EC3D). This is my 9th Kickstarter, and any of my thousands of customers can tell you about my track record of easy-to-print models - delivered on time. My skill and love for design has grown out of my passion for tabletop gaming, technology, and 3D printing. I design a  ton of the content myself and work with many other great designers and artists to put these projects together. Take a look at the quality of my free items on Thingiverse or my last campaigns Wilds of Wintertide,  Depths of Savage Atoll or Empire of Scorching Sands to get a feel for my design aesthetic, or check out some customer reviews. I am a tabletop gamer at heart, and all models are  printed, and often painted, by myself before being released.

Participating Modelers, Artists, Painters, and Printers
Credit to these awesome folks who helped this all come together!
Joshua Black (lead 3D character design),  Ulises Virgen (3D character design),  Sebastiano Di Grazia (3D character design), Ryan Calhoun (Cephalopod Studios, painting), Ruslan Ahmatnurov (concept art), and Jean Roux (art)
And a SPECIAL thank you to my wonderful wife Ally who has been unbelievably helpful, and essential in preparing this campaign!

Add-Ons

Add-ons allow you to get additional awesome stuff at a great discount, and help push even further to unlock stretch goals! There's tons of sets (including fantasy, sci-fi, and space-combat scale) with hundreds more miniatures and lots of terrain/scenery.
To get add-ons, just increase your pledge level by the amount indicated for whichever add-ons you would like. Once the KS closes I will be using a pledge manager (BackerKit) to help you finalize you add-ons. You can increase you pledge on KS now to help fund stretch goals, or get these after the campaign closes.
To add any STL stretch goals you must back the campaign at a level that includes STLs.

 Empire of Scorching Sands: My last sprawling campaign, featuring Arabian/Persian/Egyptian/desert terrain/scatter, monsters, and minis - Empire of Scorching Sands - the add-ons are equivalent to the what's included in that campaign (including stretch goals): Terrain/scatter only ($20 add-on), Minis only ($20 add-on), or ALL IN ($30 add-on).
 Wilds of Wintertide: A chilly, northern project featuring icy, arctic tundra, terrain/scatter, monsters, and minis - Wilds of Wintertide - the add-ons are equivalent to the what's included in that campaign (including stretch goals): Terrain/scatter only ($18 add-on), Minis only ($18 add-on), or ALL IN ($25 add-on).
 A Den of Alien Evil - Everything from the first volume of my "Community (Treasure)Chest" series - Mind Horror scenery, terrain, and minis. Check it out the content from the original campaign HERE ($10 add-on).
 Secret of the Crimson Troupe - Everything from the second volume of my "Community (Treasure)Chest" series - A wandering troupe with a dark secret! Check it out the content from the original campaign HERE ($15 add-on).
 The Holy Order of Ash - Everything from the third volume of my "Community (Treasure)Chest" series - A dark holy order! Check it out the content from the original campaign HERE ($15 add-on).
 Depths of Savage Atoll: A sprawling campaign, featuring nautical, jungle, pirate, and undersea minis and environs - Depths of Save Atoll - the add-ons are equivalent to the what's included in that campaign (including stretch goals): Terrain/scatter only ($35 add-on), Minis only ($35 add-on), or ALL IN ($65 add-on).
 Skyless Realms: The races and places below the surface, from my previous campaign Skyless Realms  - the add-ons are equivalent to what's included in that campaign (including stretch goals): Terrain only ($40 add-on), Minis only ($35 add-on), or ALL IN ($55 add-on).
 Novus Landing - My most recent 3D printable Kickstarter, full of scifi goodness! The add-ons are is equivalent to what's included in all-in pledge level of Novus Landing, (including unlocked stretch goals): Minis, Terrain/Scatter, or Vehicles (1 set for $25) or ALL IN (all 3 sets for $50)
 The Terra Conflict - My most recent 3D printable Kickstarter, full of space-combat scale ships, creatures, terrain, and more for epic space battles and encounters. This add-on is equivalent to what's included in the '3D Printable STL Files' pledge level of The Terra Conflict, including unlocked stretch goals ($30 add-on for the base set, and $42 for the base set + both add-on fleets).
 The Ignis Quadrant: My first foray into scifi, featuring support-free minis, tons of vehicles and lots of scatter terrain for all your scifi RPG and wargaming needs! The Ignis Quadrant - The add-ons are is equivalent to what's included in all-in pledge level, (including unlocked stretch goals): Minis, Terrain/Scatter, or Vehicles (1 set for $25) or ALL IN (all 3 sets for $50).
 Forest of Oakenspire - Everything from the core reward and stretch goals from my first Kickstarter Forest of Oakenspire at a great discount ($40 add-on).
 All EC3D Premium Sets - The full collection of all 12 previously released premium sets - over $100 value, as seen for sale on Hero's Hoard ($50 add-on)
 Individual EC3D Premium Sets - Chose any number of my EC3D scenery sets from my previously released premium set collection - substantial value over retail price, as seen for sale on Hero's Hoard ($5 per-set add-on)
** Please note ** - all the add-on items above can be purchased right now for a higher price on heroshoard.com or late pledge pages for those campaigns, but if you are willing to wait until this campaign closes to receive the files you can get a great discount AND help unlock more stuff for this current campaign.

Commercial and Resale

I have an official licensed printer program for my 3D sets, along with my partner at Hero's Hoard, which allows commercial physical resellers with a 10% commission on sales. Anybody can signup for that license, and sell the models from this campaign under that license, and I will not be doing specific merchant tiers for this campaign. So to sell these files (and other non-exclusive EC3D sets) you just need to signup for that resale program and back this campaign to receive the files.

Accountability
Everybody hates waiting, and many people have been burned by poorly designed files and broken delivery timelines in previous kickstarters from other vendors. This is not the case with my campaigns. All core models, and many stretch goals, area already finalized and test printed - and the majority of files will be ready for delivery the second the funds clear after the Kickstarter finishes (usually 2 weeks after the date the campaign ends). I will be finalizing and releasing the remaining items as fast as humanly possible, with a goal of 90 days *MAX* after this Kickstarter ends for delivery - which is something I have successfully done for all my previous Kickstarters. 

Disclaimer & Printing Requirements
To get the most out of the printable parts from this Kickstarter, you will need to have a well-tuned 3D printer. All minis are designed for FDM or resin printing, and will fit on the print beds of 99% of commercially-available at-home printers.
Every part is test printed by myself and repaired to be manifold and ready to drop on your slicer - however, In the event that any issues with the files get past my own QA testing and process, and my other test printers, I will make every effort to fix the file and remedy the situation as soon as possible. I use Dropbox for file delivery so I can push updates/fixes. My number one goal is to make some awesome, unique designs you can have a ton of fun with on your tabletop!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are very few, if any, risks and challenges for this campaign. The models have mostly been produced, and prepared for print, and I have a strong track record of delivering every campaign on schedule.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: ** I WANT IT ALL! **
support.descp:
We're keeping this campaign simple but awesome. One pledge level, and it gets you everything. All the core models + everything unlocked (and some surprise bonus models too!).
This pledge includes STL files for all the minis shown in the campaign description. **PLEASE NOTE** - this pledge is for digital files only, to print at home on your own 3D printer (resin or FDM).

updates.update_content:
Hi folks, hope you're all well!
I just uploaded the final finished model this last weekend. At this point all the models are uploaded to the Dropbox and finished! There have also been tweaks to a few models that had previously been uploaded, all of which is logged and indicated in the REWARDS SPREADSHEET.
I'm sure there will be a few more tweaks needed, so I'm guessing I'll end up uploading a few more versions of some files as folks continue to print, but as of now this project is considered complete. Don't feel any rush to download though, the access/Dropbox will be available for a long time (I say at least a year, but in reality it will pretty much be in perpetuity).

Hey folks! Wanted to give you a quick update on Dropbox issues that occurred over the weekend.
At this point, all issues should be resolved thankfully and all access (including to add-on downloads) has been restored, and I have *lots* of bandwidth to work with at this point so you should be able to download to your heart's content! Sorry again for all the troubles!
I was also made aware that the Orcs were missing from the Dropbox, which was a mistake an I just uploaded them as well. The good news is that we should be churning out the remainder of the minis over the next 1-2 weeks and delivery of this project will wrap up really fast. Cheers!

Well, you think a 10 billion dollar company like Dropbox would have support people around to assist customers on weekends, but alas - they do not. Despite all my best efforts to sort out the locked share link fiasco preventing backers from accessing rewards, I have received no help from Dropbox.
I have ~150gb of files in shared links across all my 15+ projects which I use to power distributions for all my kickstarters, addons and deliverables - so there's no good short-term solution to remedying the access issues across all files.

Hi folks! Despite some trial and tribulation with Dropbox, I'm working hard to get the files for the KS and addons in your hands.  I apologize for the hiccups on delivery - this is my 11th Kickstarter, and I've learned one lesson as truth at this point - each one has *something* that goes wrong, so I apologize!
 Please take the time to watch the quick video below if you have any questions, or are new to my Kickstarters, as it explains how BackerKit and file access works.

Well, after 5+ years of successfully using, and being a fan of, Dropbox I've finally run into a snag with their service. This was one of my largest releases to date so far, and between the massive amount of uploads I did yesterday and the downloads, my account was flagged for high traffic and share links were blocked - DOH!
I'm working with their support team to resolved, but they told me there's a good chance it can take up to 24 hrs which is a huge bummer, but I'm crossing my fingers that it's much less than that. This affects all my downloads (addons and Beast and Baddies rewards) so I'm super sorry for the service interruption, but I'm working hard on my end to get things resolved, so stay tuned!

HEYO folks, hope you're all doing well! I've been doing my best to recover from being sick the last few days but have some news/updates to share:
 Model Updates 
I had to do work to nail down a backer for the final pick (I learned through this campaign that Kickstarter doesn't always send messages to backers when you send them,  particularly if the backer is primarily using the mobile app) so that caused some delays, but it's sorted. The final model that was chosen was the WRAITH - which is ironic, considering that is the absolute first model we made when we started on this campaign many months ago, so I' super glad it was included!

Hey folks! The team has been hard at work and we have some new renders to show you! We went classic for the young dragon (red) and you can see him in his fire-breathing glory below! Also another stretch goal added to the campaign was the Banshee. Next up is the finished (and F*$!ng EPIC) Roc. Lastly, the evil wizard busts on the scene to plague your players.
There's ONE stretch goal pick remaining to be unveiled - I didn't hear from the backer and did a new backer pick this morning, so stay tuned for that.

Hi folks! We're hard at work over here workin on more models to show you. We should have a render of the young dragon to show in the next few days, and we're working on the Evil Wizard and the Undead Croc too!
Two of the 4 picks that happened after the KS ended have been sorted, and the Roc and the Giant Rat have been added to the mix! You can see our concept art of the roc below (which will get tweaked to be supportless, of course). There's still 2 more picks coming your way too. Below you can see the finished renders of the Rust Monster, Giant Rat, and the finished pair of Slaad!

Thank you all so much for an awesome, successful campaign! We unlocked tons of stretch goals and this campaign evolved into a huge set of STLs that I'm proud to share with you all!
I wanted to take a minute to outline next steps for those of you who have never participated in one of my Kickstarters before, and answer a few common questions!

When can I see the work-in-progress mins and unpicked sets?

campaign.story:
Welcome friends, fiends, earthlings, aliens and everyone in between! Introducing: Fates End 2: Terra & Cosmos! 3D printable Dice Towers + MORE for tabletop gaming!   
What you get for Loot-All+ Pledges:    
 The 15 core STL files will be released by August 2021 with all stretch goals being delivered afterwards. All files will be split for smaller printers and are support-free for easy 3D printing! Please Check the PRODUCTION SCHEDULE for release dates! 
_______________________________________________________________
Upcoming Stretch Goals
 *Any unlocked Stretch Goals will be included the my NEXT campaign! 

The Special Social Media Stretch Goal has been UNLOCKED! Say hello to The Heaven & Hell Dice Tower!     
_______________________________________________________________
Add-Ons:
Please see Update #11 for details on how to add Add-ons to your pledge. If you're a new backer, you'll find the option to add Add-ons after you select your pledge level!

Holiday Ornaments! These are really simple but they were a lot of fun to give away to my friends and neighbors last season! I printed mine in resin, about 2" tall and spray painted them with gold or silver spray paint! It's hard to get a photo that does them justice!
BANKS! I gave a way a few bonus banks in the previous campaign (just for fun) but I didn't have the time to get them as perfect as I wanted. Adding this as an Add-on will allow me to use part of my production schedule to develop an improved plug! Here's an example of the Tiamat Bank:
PLAY

_______________________________________________________________
FatesEnd has partnered with Mythos Games for a very special Stretch Goal Bonus! For every $10k raised in this campaign, we will donate one table top game to our local Children's Hospital! Thanks Mythos Games!  
_______________________________________________________________
Do you want to print test a file first? 
That's cool, we get that, so we're giving away one Dice Tower for free. Click below to get a FREE Mayan Temple Dice Tower .STL file to print today!    
_______________________________________________________________
--------------> ALL files are Print Tested and Repaired before release! <---------------
_______________________________________________________________
Concept art of all Core Set items:
5 Sci-Fi-Inspired Dice Towers
5 Earth-Inspired Dice Towers
4 Dice Jails/vaults
& 1 GM Screen     
_______________________________________________________________
More Details
Why Dice Towers? Dice towers help to prevent cheating - and allow Fate do her job! Dice Towers also add an extra level of character to your game! Each tower will include a dice tray to help protect fancy pants tables from heavy metal dice damage. Lastly (our favorite) these Dice Towers inspire envy in friend and foe alike! Enjoy that clackity-clack until fate has rendered her verdict.       
PLAY

_______________________________________________________________
What's a Dice Jail/Vault? Ah, good question! We didn't know either when we launched our previous campaign  but due to UNPRECEDENTED feedback (begging and pleading) from backers, we offered Dice Jails as stretch goals. Since then, the feedback (begging and pleading) has continued, so we were sure to provide LOTS of Dice Jails and Dice Vaults in this campaign. So, what are they? Dice Jails are intended to punish bad dice in style. Dice Vaults are for less naughty dice who need a place to stay for the night... or until their next adventure commences. 
_______________________________________________________________
EASY TO PRINT! The files will be designed to be 3D Printed easily without supports! (Supports are the WORST!)   
Actual FDM print (60% at .15 mm layer height)
_______________________________________________________________ 
Do you actually print your files? Yep, I do, then I print it again, and sometimes... again. 
PLAY

_______________________________________________________________
All files will be designed to print on smaller FDM Printers like the Prusa Mini. Files above 7" (about 177mm) tall will be split into two models so they’re printable on smaller printers. 
_______________________________________________________________
Can I print it even smaller? These objects can be any size that your printer can support, so you can print them smaller (if you have a small printer) or larger (for large dice) if desired.  All Dice towers are designed to work with standard 20mm dice at 100% scale. (*Dice set/tower scales are determined by the size of the D20 in the set.) If you can't print the towers at 100%, then print them at 60% to work with tiny 12mm dice sets (can be found in local game stores or on Amazon.) Teeeny tiny printers such as the Photon and Mars are unlikely to print the majority of dice towers AND work with existing dice. However, Dice Jails and Vaults may work, depending on size and scale. 
 (Photo of actual printed objects ^) 
Actual Resin print
_______________________________________________________________
Have bigger dice? No problem! You can 3D print these files at any scale (*that your printer can support!). Use the dice scaler tab in the PRODUCTION SCHEDULE to determine scale. 
_______________________________________________________________
What printers are supported? All files will be designed to fit within 7" square print areas (Prusa Mini). Files will be split vertically to fit taller printers.      
Printed in Resin (60%)
_______________________________________________________________
I don't have a 3D printer, how do I get a physical product? Although we won’t be selling physical prints through this campaign, we will be offering a Merchant tier that allows the sale of physical prints of all 15 core products, plus ALL unlocked stretch goals. We had a plethora of Merchants with our previous campaign, and we expect (hope) we can duplicate the same success here! 
_______________________________________________________________
Will you be including 6 tray types for towers in this campaign? Sadly, no. Instead of offering 6 simple trays, we wanted to focus on unique designs for each tray for this campaign.  All tower files will come with one removable tray. Our hope is to include spaces to hold dice, but all trays may not have a great spot for dice. Trays will be only one size, one type. In collecting feedback from the previous campaign, we found that the majority of backers were printing the same trays (large.) If we get enough feedback, we may consider an additional tray type (OpenLock perhaps?) but at this moment, one tray is what is being offered in this campaign.
Trays that are too large for our 7"x7"x7" print minimum will be split into parts using puzzle shapes for easy assembly. 
_______________________________________________________________
Can you teach me how to 3D Print? We have a Fates End Print Support Group on Facebook for all backers with lots of volunteers who can help you get started. Many of our backers from the previous campaign were first time printers, and were able to get up and running with the help of our volunteers. 
We will send the Facebook Link out to all backers after the campaign funds (usually two weeks after the campaign ends.)
_______________________________________________________________
 When will I get the files? 
Each object will take about 1 week to model, print test, repair and deliver. GM screen(s) will take two weeks. Please check the PRODUCTION SCHEDULE for Release dates.
Those who back the FatesEnd #1 & #2 or Dual License tiers will receive their FatesEnd #1 files after this campaign funds (*usually two weeks after the campaign ends.)
_______________________________________________________________ 

Quotes from backers of FatesEnd 1 (previous campaign):     
_______________________________________________________________
Previous Campaign (FatesEnd 1)
If you're interested in adding files from the previous FatesEnd campaign (FatesEnd1), but you'd like to see them first, you can find renders, photos and details here. 
PLAY

_______________________________________________________________
Improvements
We'll be fulfilling orders from this campaign through Backerkit! We're hoping for a better/clearer process for file access this time around. 

Since this is our 2nd campaign, we learned a lot from the previous one. We believe this experience will help us communicate more effectively to help fulfillment run smoothly! 
_______________________________________________________________
 MERCHANTS 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>IMPORTANT NOTICE<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<
New Merchants: The Merchant license from this campaign does not apply to the previous campaign (FatesEnd1) If you want to sell FatesEnd1 assets, we offer the Dual License for new Merchants.
Merchants from FatesEnd1: you do not need to purchase a Dual License since you already have a license to sell assets from FatesEnd1 (The first campaign). However, if you wish to sell assets from this campaign (FatesEnd2), you must back the Merchant License tier.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>><<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<
Our Merchant program in our previous campaign was a huge success! Many Merchants sold so many towers/dice jails from the previous campaign, they were able to expand their print space into a full fledged printer farm! Some Merchants were even able to convert their printing hobby into a full time job from selling FatesEnd merch! To be clear, we can't guarantee the success of every Merchant (that's honestly up to you), but it was fun to see the success of many of our Merchants, especially those who were actively engaged on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, etc.
IMPORTANT NOTE: No one is permitted to sell prints form this campaign (FatesEnd2) unless they back the Merchant License tier, or the Dual License Tier from this campaign. Selling/giving away files is strictly prohibited. 
______________________________________________________________
License duration: The license is good for a full 24 months from the date of the last released file. The more stretch goals we unlock, the longer you can sell! 
______________________________________________________________
Merchant ID. To protect our Merchants and their investment, every Merchant receives a unique Merchant ID. This makes it easy to spot sellers who haven't acquired a Merchant License and put a stop to their piracy (Yarrrrr! Avast ye swabs!)   
 Special note for FatesEnd1 Merchants: for those of you who back the FE2 Merchant tier (this campaign) We'll make sure your IDs have the same number as your FE1 ones.
Restrictions: You may use FateEnd watermarked renders in your listings, however please don’t use Fates End photos to promote your sales. Please use your own photos when listing for sales (you may use concept art until 1 week after finalized files are delivered.  
Watermarked Render Example
 ______________________________________________________________
Merchant-Only FB Support Group
We have a Merchant-only Facebook support group where you can all share photos of your prints, ask questions and help support one another. 
If you want to get a Merchant License, but you're still not sure which tier to back, please check this handy for further clarification:
Dual Licenses are only for new merchants who wish to sell prints from both campaigns.  
FatesEnd 1 Merchants already have the right to sell files from FatesEnd1. Please do not back the Dual License tier if you already have a Merchant License from the previous campaign. Please back the Merchant License tier.

Merchant Licenses and Dual Licenses from campaign 2 will not be issued until campaign 2 funds (two weeks after the end of the campaign.)

The new campaign does not limit the Merchant License duration from the previous campaign (FatesEnd 1) in any way.

****SPECIAL FOR ALL Fates End 1 MERCHANTS**** If we get more than 20 Dual-License ($550)backers in this campaign, we will extend ALL MERCHANT LICENCE durations from the FIRST campaign to match the end date of FatesEnd 2 licenses! YAY!
______________________________________________________________ 
_______________________________________________________________
Phew! You made it this far? Have more questions? No problem, feel free to email us at FatesEndTowers@gmail.com
_______________________________________________________________
OK, that's all fine and dandy, but... who are you?
Team:
Kim Bourrie - Modeler, Graphic Designer, Motion Graphics, and Creator of FatesEnd.
I am a multi-disciplined UI/UX Designer and 3D modeler, with over 23 years of professional experience designing everything from games to websites. While working for EA Games, I was responsible for the UI Design for many products including; Minions Paradise, The Sims, and TetrisBlitz. Since then, I have provided services for many titles including Fortnite, Magic the Gathering, Adventure Capitalist, Puzzle Quest, Lord of the Rings: Living Card Game, and a collection of game titles I cannot disclose at this time.  
 I am a gaming nerd down to my very core. I have traversed the wilderness of Azeroth, become the King of Tokyo, conquered fearsome Thunderjaws, been the Great Dalmuti (and the Great Peon), got sucked into space when our ship was on fire, hijacked trains in New Hanover, and made friends with BD-1. I am an avid Kickstarter supporter - a Super Backer extraordinaire! (A good portion of my fun money is spent right here!)
_______________________________________________________________
Matthew S. Armstrong - Concept Artist Extraordinaire! Matthew S. Armstrong illustrated the New York Times bestselling The Chronicles of Narnia Pop-up book with Robert Sabuda.  He has written and illustrated many picture books and comics including the Flight anthologies.  He worked for The Walt Disney Company for nine years. Also lots of collectible card games, roleplaying games and of course tons of video games like Disney Infinity and War of the Monsters.  Matthew lives with his wife, kids and super dog in a rickety old house surrounded by humongous ancient trees.
www.matthewart.com
www.instagram.com/matthew.s.armstrong 
_______________________________________________________________
Special Thanks to:
Joe Bourrie - Typo vanquisher, emotional support, hunk of burnin love (haha I'm sure that made him blush!)
Mythos Games 
And YOU! Yes YOU! Due to the success of our previous campaign, it's given me (Kim) enough confidence to go even BIGGER with this campaign! Thank you!!!!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my second campaign. The first one blasted past all of my expectations. I've learned a lot from the process, and although we had a few hiccups in the beginning, I believe, in the end, that it was a successful campaign. We have an active community of backers who support one another, and to me, that's the biggest success I could have hoped for.

I feel that there is very little risk this time around. I own all the software, hardware and a lot of learnings from the previous campaign. 

Challenge 1: Manufacturing/modeling easy to print items
Solution - Experience! I’ve been 3D Printing since 2015 and modeling since 2013. In that time, I’ve learned how to create models that don’t require supports, rafts or high infill. (Honestly, complex creations that require supports are the BANE of 3D printing! Many swarings have happened in this house due to the struggles of printing items that require complex supports.) I have owned 11+ printers (no kidding!) We currently have 3 Prusa MK3’s, 3 Prusa Minis, an Elegoo Saturn and a Anycubic Mono X.

Challenge 2: Time
Solution - Self-employed! I have the time planned out to create the remaining files for this campaign. I have the software, hardware, skill and experience, all I need is time. I am self-employed so I have complete control over my time! All I have to do is schedule the time in, and boom - we’re on track!
By funding this project, you make it possible for me to focus on this project instead of client work for a time. YOU are my client! Let’s make this happen, together!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:

Sustainable Distribution
No physical products = no waste! Although, failed prints on the otherhand... Yeah, just recycle those.

campaign.story:
Two projects in one! This Kickstarter campaign offers two dramatically different works:
 Illuminated Manuscript. A collection of web, unpublished, and older articles pulled from the company's history. Starting at 24 pages, the zine expands in size as stretch goals are unlocked and we add more articles to the collection!
 1976 Ogre Playtest Booklet. Constructed from scans of Steve's typewritten and hand-illustrated Ogre playtest set, this saddle-stitched booklet gives you a look at Ogre in its pre-publication form. Have you always wanted to learn more about Steve's first game? This book pulls back the curtains and gives you a version of the game you've not seen before!
Read on to learn more about both zines!
At project launch, Illuminated Manuscript includes a mix of web articles, the winning entry in our recent Ogre playmat scenario contest, and material from the pages of Where We're Going -- our retailer newsletter -- from 1987 and 1988.  
Digital mockup. This article showcases the progress of GURPS Space in 1987/1988, as documented in the pages of the Where We're Going Newsletter. This hard-to-find newsletter for retailers and distributors includes info that wasn't shared with GURPS players at the time the book was being created. Final may vary slightly in appearance.
Project stretch goals, if unlocked, add another twelve pages to the zine, expanding the total size to 36 pages. (See stretch goals, below, for more information.) These stretch goals include more web content and previously unreleased material. 
 The articles at project launch include:
Deluxe Illuminati: The Servants of Cthulhu Solitaire Challenge
GURPS Space, The Albatross of 1987/1988*
 Halloween d6 Dice Set Rules by Steve Jackson 
Eyes on the Prize, An Ogre Scenario**
 It’s Munchkin Party Time! with Andrew Hackard 
Designer’s Notes: Cthulhu Dice
Thinking Outside of the Box**
 Army Men d6 Dice Set Rules 
Munchkin Dungeon Design: For Munchkins, By Munchkins
 * From Where We're Going and Roleplayer (1987/1988)
** New to Illuminated Manuscript.
"This is a reproduction of an actual surviving Ogre playtest set from 1976. It consists of the rules (typed on typewriter – no word processors yet!), the map (hand-drawn by me, with the sophisticated graphics talent for which I am NOT famous), and the game counters (also hand-made by me)." 
- Steve Jackson, from the introduction (written in 2021)

Digital mockup of the 1976 Ogre Playtest Booklet. Final may vary slightly in appearance.


What an incredible treat! Dated November 4, 1976, this is Steve's typewritten playtest set for the original Ogre game. We've scanned the pages and have presented them exactly as the marked copies appear. Have you wanted a look at Ogre in its pre-publication form? This is your chance to add an unusual collectible to your Ogre library!
The booklet comes in at 20 pages (which includes the cover, back cover, and inside covers). The center includes the map. We will release the PDF as a free title once this Kickstarter campaign has closed, so you won't have to cut your booklet if you want to build the set and play the game as it existed in 1976.
Digital mockup of the 1976 Ogre Playtest Booklet. Final may vary slightly in appearance.
NOTE: None of the project stretch goals impact the content of the 1976 Ogre Playtest Booklet. This saddle-stitched zine is 100% maxed out in terms of page count and ready to go at project launch. One stretch goal upgrades the physical construction of the booklet. See below.
If unlocked, these stretch goals directly impact the Illuminated Manuscript zine.
 $2,000 - UNLOCKED! - +4 pages added to the Illuminated Manuscript. (Ogre Sixth Edition vs Designer's Editon comparison and Cthulhu Dice spell effects for fantasy RPGs*) 
 $3,500 - UNLOCKED! - +4 pages added to the Illuminated Manuscript. (Spiral Summoning for The Fantasy Trip* and Zombie Dice Designer's Notes) 
 $5,000 - UNLOCKED! - +4 pages added to the Illuminated Manuscript. (Munchkins & Mazes Designer's Notes, Gelatinous Solitaire Rules, and One On One Munchkin Monster Melee*) 
* New to Illuminated Manuscript.
If this stretch goal is unlocked, we will add three copies of a new Munchkin bookmark to all print reward levels. (This bookmark will be released as a free promo later in 2021.)
 $7,500 - UNLOCKED! - Munchkin Bosses bookmark. What is Munchkin Bosses? A new mini-expansion scheduled for release later in 2021! NEW! 
If this stretch goal is unlocked, we improve the physical construction of the 1976 Ogre Playtest Booklet.
 $10,000 - UNLOCKED! - The cover of the 1976 Ogre Playtest Booklet is upgraded to a heavier stock. 
If unlocked, the next stretch goal adds another four pages to the Illuminated Manuscript zine!
 $13,000 - UNLOCKED! - +4 pages added to the Illuminated Manuscript. (Confessions of a Tree-Hugger, How it Got to be Z-Shot, and Dragons*. All by Steve Jackson! Dragons is an unpublished dice game using standard six-sided dice.) 
* New to Illuminated Manuscript.
If the next stretch goal is unlocked, all reward levels receive one copy each of the two coaster designs. These are the same size/style as the coasters currently available at Warehouse 23. 
 $15,000 - UNLOCKED! - Two different coasters, one Ogre and one The Fantasy Trip, added to each reward level.
All stretch goals unlocked!
Digital mockup. Two coasters. The above image shows the front and back of each design.
Please note that some of the add-ons that are listed below may be limited in BackerKit. It is best to always complete your BackerKit survey early so that you can lock down your preferred extras. Contact help@sjgames.com if you have any questions about using BackerKit.
 Steve Jackson Games Coasters - $6.00
 Munchkin Coasters - $6.00
 Dice Games Coaster Pack - $2.50

 Illuminated Manuscript - $6.00
 Robin's Laws of Good Game Mastering - $13.00
 1976 Ogre Playtest Booklet - $12.00
 Raid on Iran - $20.00
 Undead - $20.00
 Truck Stop - $20.00
 Boat Wars - $20.00
 Car Wars - $20.00
 The Awful Green Things from Outer Space - $20.00
Where possible, we will offer other games and accessories from the 2019 Pocket Box Kickstarter campaign in BackerKit. Some items are very limited in number; please be sure to complete your survey ASAP to secure your preferred add-on items. 
 Deluxe Dice Bag: Cyberskull - $12.00
 Deluxe Dice Bag: Happy Faeries - $12.00
 Dragon d6 Dice Set - $9.00
 Skull d6 Dice Set - $9.00
 Gelatinous Dice Game - $15.00
These are only some of the dice, dice games, and accessories that will be offered during the BackerKit survey.
 Munchkin Crazy Cooks - $30.00
 Munchkins & Mazes - $25.00
 Munchkin Tails - $25.00
 Munchkin Something Fishy - $12.00
 Star Munchkin Accessory Pack - $8.00
We will have more Munchkin games, expansions, and accessories listed in the BackerKit survey.
To select a reward level, please see the list of pledge options at right. The Illuminated Manuscript and 1976 Ogre Playtest Booklet rewards levels are unlimited; we will print as many zines as necessary to meet demand. Other reward levels may include limits. If those limits are met, we will review the situation and open up more slots when possible.


 NOTE: Street addresses only.
After the Kickstarter project closes, and after all pledges are collected, we will open the BackerKit pledge manager. There, you will tell us your Warehouse 23 email address, provide your physical address, and pay for shipping. You will also have the chance to add more items to your rewards package. See the FAQ for estimated shipping costs.
Failure to complete your BackerKit survey by the deadline (which will be announced in a Kickstarter update once the pledge manager opens) will result in a refund and removal from the project. We cannot allow projects to remain open forever; we must set firm deadlines so that we can properly close campaigns.
If you wish, you may choose to use a fulfillment service. This allows you to pledge for the project and then provide us with a U.S. address for the delivery of your rewards. Forwarding from the fulfillment service, as well as any local fees, is your responsibility when using a fulfillment company. 
NOTE: Taxes, where applicable, will be charged in BackerKit.
Because of the increased complexity and expense of international shipping, this project is limited to U.S. backers only. If the campaign succeeds we will offer both the Illuminated Manuscript and 1976 Ogre Playtest Booklet at our online store, Warehouse 23.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Steve Jackson Games is an established game publisher with a successful track record and we have enough Kickstarter experience to deal with issues should they arise. Both works are very close to completion, and now it's time for you to tell us whether or not to finish these projects and release them to the world.

As we've done in the past, we will stay in touch with you during and after the Kickstarter, all the way through fulfillment of the rewards.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.descp:
United States only. Steve Jackson Games' Illuminated Manuscript in print. An 8.5" x 5.5" 24-page B&W zine collecting articles from the web alongside unpublished material and a handful of pieces from the company's past. Unlock stretch goals to add more pages to the Illuminated Manuscript zine!
Also includes a PDF copy of the zine!
Shipping costs collected in BackerKit. See the campaign description, at left, for more information.

Illuminated Manuscript Print

support.title: 1976 Ogre Playtest Booklet (Print)
support.descp:
United States only. An 8.5" x 11" saddle-stitched book featuring a high-resolution scan of the 1976 Ogre playtest set. This is Steve's typewritten and hand-illustrated playtest set including decades of distress and the original marks written on the pages. Includes rules, hand-illustrated map, and Steve's 1976 counter designs.
Counters are printed on the back of the book, making it possible to remove the cover and cut the counters out if you want to experiment with this decades-old playtest set. Or, use the included PDF to print out the contents and DIY your own set!
NOTE: We will release the PDF as a free download after the campaign ends.
Shipping costs collected in BackerKit. See the campaign description, at left, for more information.
INCLUDES:
1976 Ogre Playtest Edition PDF
1976 Ogre Playtest Edition Print

updates.update_content:
As of yesterday afternoon, the last of the print rewards for this campaign left Warehouse 23 and are now on their way to you. When you receive your rewards, please email help@sjgames.com if you run into any issues or have questions. We don't always catch every comment or message on Kickstarter, so emailing us at help@sjgames.com is the best way to ask the team for support.
What's next?

Great news! The Warehouse 23 team has all of the necessary items and they've officially started shipping your rewards. We will need some time to properly pack and ship everything, so we'll post another update once the last items have left the warehouse. Please be patient as we may need a little time to get all of your rewards packaged and shipped.
Hexagram #7
In other news, our next issue of The Fantasy Trip Hexagram series is scheduled to launch on Kickstarter next month. For those of you who have not yet tried the game, we're including a reward level that is designed as an introduction to the game and includes everything you need to play.

We're getting closer to the day we can start mailing out all of the rewards! The bookmarks and coasters needed for project fulfillment have landed at Warehouse 23 . . . and the Illuminated Manuscript zine is expected later this week.
We don't have an exact fulfillment date, but we can say that we're ahead of the May estimated delivery date. We'll post an update once everything has arrived and the warehouse team starts packing and shipping your rewards.

Surveys are now open! You have until March 24 -- next Wednesday -- to complete your survey. On the 25th, we will issue refunds to any incomplete surveys and remove the stragglers from the project. This is so that we can properly manage the campaign and prepare to shift everything to the post-survey stage.
Finding Your Survey

campaign.story:
The classic match up of dwarves vs dragons is now available to 3d print as your own thematic chess set. Will the dwarves be able to reclaim their dwarven halls or will the dragon's reign of terror continue? The matter can only be settled on the chess board!
 Dwarves vs dragons includes the stil files for both a dwarven set of chess pieces and a dragon set of chess pieces. You also get the files to make your own chess board in a variety of styles.

The Dwarven chess pieces 
From left to right; pawn, knight, bishop, prince, king, rook

 The Dragon chess pieces
From left to right; pawn, knight, bishop, queen, king, rook

                    A closer look at the pieces

 The Pawns 

                                   The Knights

                                    The Bishops           
                                     The Rooks

                      The Queen and the Prince
I found myself having difficulty visualising a dwarven queen, so we've got a prince here to fill that role.

                                     The Kings
 The base of each chess piece has a space to allow coins/metal washers to be attached for anyone that wants the chess pieces to feel heavier.



                                  Chess Tiles
The construction of the chess board allows you to chose what types of tiles you'd like, There are five options.
                                  Chess Board
As you may have noticed the chess board has a dwarven theme to it's design. This is my favourite configuration of the tiles.


                                   Broken Tiles
Dragons are heavy creatures and it's not surprising that they would have an impact on their surroundings. If you'd like to reflect this on the chess board there are a multitude of broken and shattered tiles for you to choose from. 

 NZ $1 - What's Happening Here?
Pledging one dollar will keep you up to date with what's going on and make you feel like a terrific person.
Approximately US $0.72, UK £0.53, Euro €0.59

 NZ $20 - Dwarves vs Dragons
 20 NZ dollars will get you the stil files for the Dwarves vs Dragons chess set.
Approximately US $14.44, UK £10.55, Euro €11.88

 NZ $20 - Kings in Conflict
Maybe dwarves and dragons aren't you're thing. You can pledge NZ $20 to get the medieval chess set (and board) along with a wizard set from my previous Kickstarter campaign 'Kings in Conflict'. All unlocked stretch goals from that campaign are included.
Approximately US $14.44, UK £10.55, Euro €11.88
Medieval chess set from left to right; pawn, knight, bishop, queen, king and rook.
Wizard chess set from left to right; pawn, knight, bishop, queen, king and rook. An optional wizard piece included
One of the unlocked stretch goals from this campaign, checker/draught pieces.

For a closer look at this campaign follow the link below:


 NZ $37  - All the Chess Sets
If you'd like both the 'Dwarves vs Dragons' and the 'Kings in Conflict'  this is the pledge level for you.

Approximately US $26.71, UK £19.51, Euro €21.97


 There are no stretch goals for this campaign.

There has been some interest in a dwarven queen piece. Apparently I like to design what my backers want so a queen piece for the dwarves will be available to purchase from Wargame Vault at the conclusion of this campaign. 
Dwarven Queen

There has also been some demand for the magical tile designs from the 'Kings in Conflict' Kickstarter campaign, so that too will be available as an add on from Wargame Vault.  
All files were printed using fdm printers (an Up Box + and an Ender 3 Pro) and used rafts and supports. They were designed using 3ds Max and ZBrush and have been run through a repair tool.

You can try out a test sample of the dragon pawn here:
https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:4746584 

Some examples of printed and painted models.

 The chess pieces can be printed as one piece or as two pieces - a top and a base which push fit together. There is also an optional base cap that can be printed but needs to be glued on.

The chess board is comprised of three designs -  the corner, the side and the centre pieces. The chess tiles are slotted in on top of that.
PLAY

For extra rigidity I've glued my board down to a piece of wood.


Fulfillment of 'Dwarves vs Dragons' will be completed through WargameVault. Each backer will receive copies via their account. Fulfillment will begin as soon as possible. This should hopefully be within 2 weeks of the project funding. A survey will be sent out shortly after the project has funded to gather email addresses associated with WargameVault accounts. Please note, this is the only way to gain these files. You will then have the files in your library so you can access them as often as you would like. Any updates to the files will also appear there.


 I've run several Kickstarter campaigns before, all delivered on time.
 My previous campaigns are available to purchase from the WargameVault webstore.

 Or check out my Kickstarter profile page here for a closer look at the campaigns:

 For those interested in licensed printing of these or my other Kickstarter files - allowing you to sell printed copies - here is a link to my patreon page: https://www.patreon.com/foxcraftcreations .
For this license the stl files must be purchased first.
 Keep up to date with this and future projects at www.facebook.com/foxcraftcreations

campaign.story:
I couldn't stay away.
ZineQuest is a really cool initiative, and I've never participated.
So, I made a zine. Not fancy. It's all very DIY and all the work is done by me. I've been noodling on hacking up a d100 OGL system for a while, and I'd been tinkering with the ruleset during down hours. So I sat down and finished it, did some layout stuff on it, and built this Kickstarter page, all in six hours. 
Short of drawing all the art myself, it doesn't get more DIY than that. (I debated drawing the art myself, but I figured I'd spare you.)
So. Swordpoint is a d100 swashbuckling-themed zine using the Legend OGL (from Mongoose Publishing). The tone and theme is inspired by Musketeers, Captain Alatriste, and European Continent around the 1600s, as well as older games like En Garde, Flashing Blades, and more.
The rules are condensed to about 60 pages in a 5"x8" landscape format. I always wanted to try a landscape book, and I like how they read on tablets and phones, so I figured why not.
I did all the layout myself, so it's not super fancy, but I tried to keep it simple and functional. 
What it has:
The rules you need to play. A hacked d100 system (it'll feel familiar if you know d100 RPGs.)
New rules for this iteration of the d100 RPG: Style points. Streamlined combat. A lightweight magic system. 
Genre rules for grudges, revenge, rank, duels, and some enemies (not many enemies though. Like 3.)
A planned compatibility license.
 PDF bookmarks. I just learned how to do that this morning!
Character sheet mock-up I made. We'll see.
What it doesn't have:
Lots of rules.
Lots of art. Most of the art is from Shutterstock or public domain. There's only like 5-6 pieces in the book total, just to fill white space.
Fancy layout. Remember: DIY and I am not a layout artist. It should be pretty straightforward and easy to read though.
Stretch goals (at least right now.)
The writing is probably kinda dry. I wrote in very technical style, 'cause I was inspired by older RPGs (one of my proof-readers even commented on that, so I figure I'll warn you.)
Layout Sample

The Plan
Once we close, I'll send the PDF out to backers to submit feedback. I think we got most of the errors, but I've learned not to count on that. I'll incorporate the feedback. Then we'll go to print and delivery. No muss, no fuss. 
Shipping
Physical is shipping to the US only. Sorry. It sucks and I hate having to restrict it but it's too easy to lose money or get caught unawares by shipping changes (hey Brexit.) 
Extra will be available via the GKG webstore after the campaign though, so if you want, you can get it then and we'll try to give you the best rate possible. 
GKG has shipped thousands of packages, so it should be pretty straightforward.

Quick reminder: Ten of you have not finished your shipping surveys yet. Please do so ASAP! We're going to begin shipping this week (probably tomorrow) and it's easiest if you've got your address in!

Thanks everyone!
