campaign.story:
Thumbies : Thumbmart is a one to eight player game. After each player decides which Survivor Character they wish to be, the group selects a Survivor Chapter.
Every Survivor Chapter drives a unique story, prepares the board and outlines directives. Some chapters are solitary incidents, and some chapters are part of expansive story arcs that follow a survivor on their saga.
Game play gets very hands on after this point.
Each player will gather their first personal bit of biometry by measuring their hand span from thumb to little finger with the built-in ruler. This information is used by the ZOMBIE Framework which is expressed in greater detail further down the page in Ground Breaking Elements. The ZOMBIE Framework is the way this game connects YOU to the board and creates an intricate and dynamic gaming experience without troubling the player with complex calculations or classic pen and dice game mechanics.
In this game I decided to call the Zombie opposition 'Thumbies' as a tribute to this unique biometric system. Using the Survivor Chapter and everyone's hand spans the players will populate the board with some Thumbies that were hanging around before the players entered the scene.
Players use a different Hand Span to determines how many items a player can carry in their inventory.
During your quest to survive you will collect hundreds of useful and sometimes not so useful items. Players will need to determine what items they need to keep and which items they must discard or trade. Discovery and circumstances play an important role during every session – what might have been the game-winning resource management strategy for one session becomes the tragic miscalculation for another. This is one reason why chapters are so addictive and re-playable.
The game begins once players finish agreeing who gets which items from the load out deck.
Found item cards are obtained from Thumbies.
And Board Stock Cards are item cards obtained from specific storage locations situated around the game board.
These locations are often locked and require keys or codes to open.
Cards with expendable supply like guns, ammunition and first aid use a tally system situated on their edges instead of small resource tokens that always seem to go missing between game sessions.
The tally system on the cards interface with your player board. This is where a player stores their active items, player and survivor card and keeps track of their level and current health.
As players make kills the Thumbie tokens are placed in the Player board to count levels, unlocking Survivor Cards. Players draw their Survivor Card at random sometimes finding that a good trait has materialized or a disadvantageous trait has developed. Don't worry, at higher levels player's will have a chance to replace survivor cards as their character becomes more battle hardened.
During game play players try and meet the victory conditions of their Survivor Chapter while pesky Thumbies pour into the game area using the ZOMBIE Framework.
Sometimes unanticipated events are drawn instead of items making hordes of Thumbies pour in or the dreaded All-thumbs Monster to amalgamate. Such examples of events can prove to be a tipping point for survival, and necessitate the groups consensuses to change strategy or perish in disorganized confusion.
When a player gets hit they attribute the damage on their player board condition monitor moving the token on their handy player board.
Thumbies transcends the static game experience again by placing your personal biometrics on the line. The player board condition monitor corresponds to your characters ability to move and function in-game. The result is transmitting game damage into the allowable finger combinations a player is permitted to utilized for actions like, movement, rescuing and attacking.
Using the ZOMBIE Framework™ Thumbies® has broken away from traditional Hex or grid based combat systems liberating the combat experience using an organic versatility. Even attacking is hand rationalized!
Tabletop beginners and veterans will enjoy the quick resolution and sublime game mechanics of Thumbies. And those who are truly paying attention for the high stakes pay-off can capitalize on such game changers with the Build Plan system facilitated by random draw and careful inventory management.
Thumb-mart is the first step on our ambitious journey to bring you more game sets in the Thumbies Series. This game set support hundreds of hours of gaming and exportation, character building and memorable close shaves. It is our goal to provide the most fun and creative gaming experience we can muster; and so Thumbies : Thumbmart was also designed to be integrated with future game sets. Each a stand-alone collection in their own right every set has the ability to link to other sets forming a veritable landscape of epic game play using the ZOMBIE Framework.
Two such game sets are already in the works and will be announced early next year. Linking is an option to uncover more story, unlock tiered difficulty chapters and experience the option of longer epic game-play using the special Aftermath Challenges.
1 Player Solo up to 8 Players Team Game Play
Thumbies® is engineered to respond to any number of players from a single individual up to eight players using measuring elements obtained at the beginning of game play.
Innovative Player Board
The player board is a cluster of ideas made possible by a tri-layer board developed to alleviate the need for counting chits, counters or pen and paper record keeping. Rationed or expended items use a notch based tally system built into the board keeping the item card in place so a visual representation of its stock can be tallied. Hollows keep a record of character level development with overlapping summaries to track advancement and save space. And the center hand print image with its hollows serve as a reminder to the player for which two fingers to biometrically use when modifying their movement span if and when their character is hurt.
ZOMBIE Framework Whitepaper
The integrated math and subsequent engineering model that governs the entire game is called the Z.O.M.B.I.E. Framework ® a smart acronym representing the systems larger more technical name : the (Zone Operational Movement Biometrically Intrinsic Engine). This framework's chief founding purpose is to cloak complex statistics by providing an auto-calculated operation that can be interpolated into actionable game play mechanics like movement, combat, challenges, and other RPG derivatives like abilities. The effective cloaking provides the satisfaction of a statistically rich environment while lessening the computational aspect tabletop games often encounter when rationalizing elaborate game play. This effort, of course, was designed to elevate the gaming experience so players can focus on feelings and fun and let the Framework do the work.
ZOMBIE FRAMEWORK ELEMENT 1 : Board Contour and Features
The geometry of the board is made using a series of underpinning theorems that relate to the playable area. Accounting for any number of players between 1 and 8, the individual variance in hand sizes, given trip-related journeys and coverage of selected game play mechanics; token size and weight, the coefficient of friction and zone based occupancy optimization. Mission instructions and card randomization complement these rules... and sometimes break them, thus making up a finely tuned and abstract difficulty tool.
ZOMBIE FRAMEWORK ELEMENT 2 : Hand Biometrics
To increase the feel of player relatability to the environment, the ZOMBIE Framework took hand-measurements and turned them into operational character mechanics. The system could have used grid or hexed based models for movement and action resolution but that would have drastically reduced the work achieved in board design; especially considering the effort placed in accounting for the distribution of hand averages in contours and features. Furthermore it would have left out a delicious morsel of biopsychiatry that will be mentioned further in the paper.
Thus, hand biometrics are used to rationalize 100% of character statistics and activities making for an organic feel and a distinct and hitherto unimagined innovation in tabletop gaming. In Thumbies® digit length, distance between tips, segment lengths, grouping widths, span flexibility, closed and open palm sizes are all utilized biometrics. And due to the unique anatomy of the opposable thumb saddle-joint a special design was employed in this system that sets at the fulcrum of Thumbies® giving life to the game and its name-sake.
ZOMBIE FRAMEWORK ELEMENT 3 : Board Based Assist
The ZOMBIE Framework does not require a game master or any user to move zombies one by one or do any ancillary accounting typically found in classical RPG and tabletop systems. Players can effectively move hundreds of tokens (zombies in this case) with one motion and the aforementioned contours makes them disperse in a meaningful way to create bottlenecking, pincer attacks and the type of movement we all might expect from a massive crowd of thronging creatures
Culturally speaking the ZOMBIE Framework also acknowledges both the classic definition of zombie (Night of the Living Dead model) as slow shambling throngs but is versatile and robust enough to include other zombie types such as exploding, area effect, running attacking and gargantuation. These all appear in gameplay depending on the survivor chapter, and more continue to be invented as the next boards are designed and the script continues.
ZOMBIE FRAMEWORK ELEMENT 4 : Biopsychiatry
The ZOMBIE Framework gives the player an impression of survival because you can physically fight-it-out and make attempts to outmaneuver their foe. Players are connected to the game by the anatomy of their hand and associate their characters' limitations with themselves identifying with game play stronger than dice-deck-dial based systems.
We as humans are inextricably tied to learning with our hands and involving our hands when we think and do even when hands are not being employed. This cognitive fact has a biopsychiatry effect that only became realized during the alpha testing of the game. Simply put we felt more invested and tried to survive harder as if our life was on the line. The non-passivity of the game through the frequency of hand use was making us players emotionally chemically invested in the game and not just because we wanted to win but because we thought we could against any and all odds - a thing I realized falls off when you count the odds in traditional dice-deck-dial games. Making Thumbies® both a fun and fantastic gaming experience and a truly groundbreaking discovery.
Exact shipping will be calculated and charged after the campaign closes. A few months before the game ships we will contact you through the pledge manager one last time regarding shipping to double check our records to make sure we get the game to right address. Shipping will be charged all at one time. We are doing it this way to try and save on costs to you because our sources say that prices may lessen as the Covid-19 crisis lessens.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and Challenges 

We are working very hard to deliver this project on time, and we have every confidence that Thumbies will be on schedule and of the highest possible quality.

That said, there are always complexities and considerations in a project of this scope that may cause delays. Playability LLC will use contract manufacturing to make the game, freight forwarders to get games through customs, and 3rd Parties like the U.S. Post Office, Fed Ex to ship the games to you - we don't control everything and there are opportunities for delay. We will work to the best of our ability to make everything work out for backers in the end - so please be confident and supportive of our efforts to get this epic game in your hands. 

Terms & Conditions

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that final look, materials, and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in and submit your project survey results (i.e. provide us your shipping address) for your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge ( at additional cost for international backers) if you complete your project survey after the 8-week window has elapsed.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for general release.

If you are reading this, you are seriously considering supporting us. We want you to know we take this very seriously. We promise to work as hard as we possibly can to deliver to you the best game experience. When Playability LLC/Thumbies hits your doorstep, we want you to be very excited about the game. Playing it the 100th time should be as epic as unboxing it and playing it the 1st time...
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Board materials are made of extra thick chipboard and tokens are High Density Fiber Board (HDF) which is harder and denser than your ordinary meeple.
Reusability and recyclability
Entire game is biodegradable and avoids the use of plastic chips of pieces. And High Density Fiber Board (HDF) in a truly eco-friendly product that enjoys recyclability.
Sustainable materials
High Density Fiber Board (HDF) is used instead of wood for tokens. Processing HDF avoids environmentally hazardous chemicals and wood is grown and milled specific to HDF and not logged from environmentally sensitive forests that would otherwise cause habitat loss.

The Coaching-Inn model now available for download on Minihoarder and the 3Dlayeredscenery website. 
I've made a small change to the doors on this model which makes them all functional with the use of a piece of filament.  The model is quite large and every floor had to be cut up in 6 individual pieces, even the 15mm model had to be cut in 2 pieces to fit on an average buildplate.

updates.update_content:
In search for a Concept Artist
We are currently looking for a Concept Artist with a taste for medieval and ancient architecture. If you or someone you know might be interested in creating concepts for the future 3Dlayeredscenery projects, feel free to send me an email at: layered3dscenery@hotmail.com

New Stretch Goals available for download
Two stretchgoals have been added to Minihoarder and are available for download.

The Generic Store,
The generic can be used to sell different goods including bread, potions, weapons and besides this there is an empty shelve included incase you'd want to use the model as a residential building.

Two new additions to the Leichheim city!
Today we have two new stretchgoals available, the three smaller slum buildings and the Library building. Both are now available for download on Minihoarder.

New addition to the Leichheim city
We’re happy to release the guardhouse/barrack to the list of models! This one is now available for download on Minihoarder. We’ve also included some interior walls and door options to this building, comparable to what we did with the brothel.

Not only has the Thieves guild been added to Minihoarder but the Brothel as well, you've already seen some renders of the Thieves Guild in our last update so here are some renders of the Brothel. It is a fairly large structure with multiple rooms in the interior, the rooms are accessible by lose doors that use a piece of filament as a hinge.

updates.update_content:
Thieves guild model
The Thieves guild model has been finished and is currently test printing. You can look forward to seeing this model including a few updates to older models this Friday the 19th. If you compare the Thieves guild to the concept art, you’ll be able to tell that there have been made some changes regarding the roof. During modelling we’ve noticed that the initially planned roof design would make the building very bulky. Therefore, it was decided to redesign this part fully.

updates.update_userinfo: Prospect for the next two weeks.
updates.update_content:
At the moment I am very busy finishing my thesis for my study in mechanical engineering. The deadline for the final version is February 8th. Until this date I'll have my hands full and unfortunately I won't have time to design. 

After submitting my thesis, I will be working on the leichheim models full-time and the stretch goals will be rolling out weekly (with the exception of some huge models, the church for example).

campaign.story:
Project Astrala 3d render
Project Astrala 3d render
Prototype Project Astrala
Prototype Project Astrala
Welcome to Project Astrala, My name is Lantz Jones and I am here to get support and funding from people just like you who wish to see my product become a reality, so lets get started. Project Astrala began as just a dream, I was tired of seeing overpriced off the shelf bluetooth speakers that catered toward looking fancy and cool instead of focusing on the sound quality. Early 2020 I was able to see my dream begin its steps to infancy as I was able to purchase my first 3d printer, mind you i had no idea at the time on how to effectively manage and use a 3d printer, let alone create a 3d file. So my information journey began. I spent weeks researching as much as i could on 3d printers until finally I felt comfortable enough to try to 3d print a file I had found on Thingiverse, now being the slight nerd that I am, my first 3d print was the Pokemon Lapras. After that successful 3d print I went on to finding more things I wanted to 3d print, but after a time I decided I wanted to try my hand at designing my own 3d files. That is is when I remembered about the off the shelf bluetooth speaker issue I had. So after tons of more research I jumped into designing my own bluetooth speaker, and being as I had already had a background in home and car audio I already had a leg up on where I wanted to go with my idea. So after several trial and errors and wasted filament I finally had what I had dreamed of, and Project Astrala was born. Now enough backstory lets get on to what you really came here for. Project Astrala is a 3d printed Hifi bluetooth speaker that utilizes a quarter wave transmission line enclosure for dual 2" full range drivers being pushed by a 10w stereo Bluetooth BT 5.0 amp board powered by 3.7v lithium ion battery. Along with a few cosmetic options. But the primary focus is on the sound quality, Project Astrala produces crystal clear, clean audio and can reproduce some lower end bass frequencies that normally would not be heard in a 2" full range driver, thanks to the enclosure style. Now after writing out a full blown essay, I would like to thank you for your future support and for the fact you took the time to read all of this.
Sincerly, Lantz Jones

updates.update_content: I also want to mention that I have very recently remodeled Project Astrala to use less time and materials for production but still retain the crystal clear audio and extended bass. It now utilizes a 85 hertz tuned enclosure, with a 3" passive radiator perfectly suited for the dual 2" full range drivers. Still uses the same electronics so the quality is still there, but just utilizing a different design to produced the same quality audio.

So with around 24 hours left in this campaign, I wanted to reach out and apologize for the lack of updates and to address a few things. Sadly due to things out of my control, I have been unable to really promote and get the following necessary to make this a successful Kickstarter campaign. I have had many things happen that just did not allow me to dedicate the time and energy necessary, and I just wanted to formally apologize to the few backers that I do have. I do have some good news though, I will still be undertaking the production of Project Astrala, along with some newer projects that I hope will be a big hit as well. This Kickstarter may have failed, but I did still receive a ton of interest outside of Kickstarter. So here is the deal, I will be setting up kind of a pre-order list for those still interested in purchasing a Project Astrala, so if anyone is still interested, just email me at emeraru.audio3d@gmail.com
I appreciate all the Backers that have contributed so far, and I am looking forward to reaching my funding goal and getting Project Astrala out and onto the market for everyone to enjoy.

campaign.story:
Hey Kickstarter, it’s Longer again! Thanks for your support in 2019, you helped us make our first project into ture, and it’s in mass production and become one of most popular affordable resin 3d printers in market. With thousands of reviewing and feedback from uers in community, the next generation 3d printer is bringing out.

The majority of LCD 3D printers in market are built in 5.5” 2K resolution of LCD screen, and the converntional pixel size of screen is 47.25um, is there any way to get a higher precision solution? If upgrade the 2K LCD screen to higher resolution for 4K, the pixel size will be driven down to 31.5um. Furthermore, if a pixel can be divided into 3 subpixels, the resolution in one direction will be as fine as 10.5um, which is a dramatic improvement over the 2K LCD screen.
With the algorithm embedded in Longerware, the UV exposure through each subpixel will be controlled accurately to deliver final 3D models with ultra-smooth surfaces and ultra-fine details.
Orange 4K is born!
Orange 4K is improved with one stand cover, built by metal body and dual liner guide, which is more stable and reliable. And it’s integrated with 2.8” touch screen, plastic resin vat with scale and simple levelling declined built plate.
The printed volume of Orange 4K is 118*66*190mm(4.64”*2.6”*7.48”). Orange 4K is equipped with 5.5” lcd screen, and there’re color & mono screen in configuration, reaching at 4K resolution 812 PPI. When configurated with color screen, one pixel in XY direction is 31.5um; while update with mono screen, one pixel of X direction is 31.5um, but Y direction has driven down to 10.5um. Moreover, The LCD screen has been improved on manufacturing procedure, and coated with galss cover over the screen, which will be better on protection. 
Orange 4K will be compatible with LongerWare, Chitubox & Lychee slicer, and we will setup the default printing parameter for color screen and monochrome screen. It will be much easier for user to select and configurate the printing parameter. 
Orange 4K Color 3d printer is able to upgrade to mono screen as well, but need to update the firmware. When Orange 4K is configurated with mono screen, the printing speed is up to 2s per layer, which will be increasing by 300% to reach at 60mm/h. 
PLAY

Thanks 3DArtGuy designed of Archagnel with Diorama, this character miniature printed by Orange 4K Color was got an amazing quality. 
PLAY

 Please reach our update #1 to figure out 4K Color & 4K Mono Printer difference. 
 Why Kickstarter? 
Longer has our own R&D team and has the design ability for hardware, firmware embedded, mechanical, and slicer development.  With months development and testing by our R&D team, the prototype of Orange 4K finally passed the test and printed with high qualified result. 

Launching on Kickstarter is building the bridge between initial users and Longer, and we hope we will get more feedback from customers and even make more improvement before this printer push into market. The voices from initial users are important to us.
 Longer 3D was established in 2014 but started with 3d printing material and industrial 3d printers. With years development on R&D, we have accumulated our own hardware designed ability, software and slicing algorithm on 3d printers and got 50 patents on 3d printing. We launched consumer 3d printers in 2018 and built with our own factory, then marketing with LONGER brand since 2019. Now we have established 10+ foreign warehouses, two fixing centers in US and three fixing service in Euro to provide better support service for customers. We keep the ultimate pursuit with our value: With Longer, Make it Better, to provide better quality and more affordable 3d printers for customers.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 2nd campaign on Kickstarter, and Orange 4K is the third product of our LCD SLA 3D printers line, but the ultra finest solution in market now. With our mature supply chain and according with quality control policy of our own factory, we are confident that this new product will be delivered as planned; because we are not only for Kickstarter campaign, but for the market of resin 3d printers.

However, we still need to face some challenges and unexpected exception occurred during this project. For sure we will resolve the problems finally and keep the promised we made because we have the ability of hardware design, decoding on programming and slice software development of our R&D department. And we also will promise to keep update with our backers on this campaign.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Bluffy Pirates is an extremely fun, highly competitive, strategic party game, suited for groups from 4 to 6 people. The game is usually full of good (and bad ) emotions, as two main key aspects are timing and, as the name suggests, bluffing.
Move a tiny bit too early, and your treasure will be snatched right from your grip. A little too late? Well, better luck next turn.
The game never stops surprising you, as every player plays it a bit different. So many strategies, so many variables, and a single choice that will decide if you get to win the treasure, or see it hauled away to a foe's ship.
Each round, players fight each other for one of the many different magical treasures. During one's turn, the player has two choices: either play a card with a symbol of the treasure of the round, or skip the turn, waiting for better opportunities, or simply missing the necessary card to play. Players take turns clockwise, deciding on the best strategy to win the treasure. Once a player holds a treasure for an entire turn, he gets to take it back to his ship and gains its special effect. The game is over, once a player collects 4 different treasures.
The best part of the game is when you feel like a mastermind, like you've outsmarted all of your friends.  While everyone was fighting for the treasure, you were waiting for the perfect moment to strike. Just when one of your friends was about to take the treasure back to his ship, you laugh at his face and curb his expectations, by taking the treasure into your own hands. You feel ecstatic, you are about to win the game. And just at the moment when you think that you had it in the bag... One of your friends starts laughing at your face and you very well know, what's about to come.
There's no better feeling than crushing your friends' hopes and becoming the one, who takes the treasure home.
Rules + Components (Prototype)
PLAY

PLAY

Stretch Goals!
SHARE YOUR IDEAS!
Hi, I really want to make this project better. So I am asking for your help. Write comments on what I should change or add. Thank you very much :)
PLAY


 SHIPPING
If you plan on ordering in bulk, please leave a message for discounts.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
It is our first project, and we understand that no matter how much we prepare, there is always a possibility of unforeseen issues. However, we are fully determined to do everything in our power to ensure this project goes smoothly. We pledge to do all we can so the game will be of best possible quality, and most importantly, delivered on time.

Communication is vital in a project like this. We will keep you regularly updated about our progress and challenges in a clear and transparent way.

SHIPPING ADVISORY

Due to the outbreak of COVID-19, many airlines have been forced to decrease, suspend, or cancel flights. As a result, air freight capacity and frequency to many destinations have been interrupted, delayed, or suspended until further notice.

As the global health situation evolves, please enquire about any possible service disruptions that might be affecting your country's postal operators and customs regulators before placing an order.

You can contact us directly on Kickstarter or on our Facebook page at:

https://www.facebook.com/BluffyPirate
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Important notice: The delivery of the printed deck will be delayed to January or even February 2021 due to unexpected high interest, winter holidays and a non responsive manufacturer. Read more about it in the update #5

Have you ever had the problem of needing to describe a dungeon and none of the players could really imagine how the structure is actually built? You don't always have to draw a battle map. Sometimes a small picture is enough to quickly show what the situation around the players looks like. Or did you ever try to come up with a dungeon room on the fly and just could not come up with an interesting layout? This deck of dungeon cards is perfect for those situations. 36 (now 54) unique cards full of stairs, dark corners, slim corridors, claustrophobic rooms, crates, barrels and much more to place monsters and treasure in.
Cards can be either used separately or combined to form larger dungeons. You can reveal one card after another as your players make their way through the dungeon and make them curious about each corner.
The cards are made out of professional 310gsm card stock with a blue core and smooth linen finish for the professional look & feel. The deck comes in a custom printed tuck box with a protective matte coating to give your cards the home they deserve. 
Speaking of... Each map (as well as the back of the card and the box) is completely hand-drawn. All 36 cards are already done and just need to be sent off to the printer.
So why Kickstarter? This is a test for me to see if such a deck is even wanted by enough people. If this project gets funded I can let the cards print for a reasonable price per deck without making a loss or charging an impossible high price.
Support Tiers
5€ - Get the PDF
You will get the full Deck of Dungeons (including the back side) as a PDF. This is perfect for those that would like to support this project but can't (or don't want to) afford the price of the physical deck + shipping costs.
15€ - Get the printed deck
You will get the physical Deck of Dungeons. Perfect for Dungeon Masters, as a present or just as a collectors item.
18€ - Physical & digital deck
Get both - The PDF and the printed deck. This is for people who play classically as well as digitally or want to collect the printed deck and use the digital one.
If you want more than one deck please contact me with the shipping country. I would need to calculate the additional costs depending on where to ship. Thank you for your understanding :)
Stretch Goals
I am very hesitant when it comes to stretch goals for this project. This is my first kickstarter and I just want everyone to get what they expect and as smoothly as possible. But if the project gets a lot more supporters than expected, I probably have no choice. So here is the goal:
[Unlocked] 300 Supporters - 54 Cards
If we hit 300 or more supporters I will increase the number of cards in this deck to 54. It doesn't matter if for the physical deck or the PDF version. If we reach 300 backers the deal is sealed. I will invest some extra time to come up with 18 additional cards.
So if you would like to have a thicker deck make sure to share this project and encourage your friends to grab a copy as well ;)
 Shipping
The Deck of Dungeon gets shipped worldwide. The shipping costs will be added after you selected your pledge level. 
Germany: 6 €
Rest of the EU, USA, Canada, Japan: 11 €
Rest of the world: 13 €
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Even though this is my first kickstarter I am fairly confident that everything will go smoothly. The designs for the deck and tuck box are done and I already got several prototype prints of the deck from the printer to check the quality and made some adjustments.

Of course it is always possible that something goes wrong during each step of the process and the shipping could get delayed. But I will try everything possible to avoid those problems and keep you updated on each and every step.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hurray! 🎉 The first batch of shipments went out today. It's not the majority of packages but it's already a good start with countries all over the world.  Don't worry if you didn't get your tracking code today. The Fulfilment center needs a bit to pack and send out all ~1500 packages.
Okay, all fine and good. But when will you actually hold the Decks in your hands?
If you live in Germany you can expect the shipment to arrive within a couple of days after you received the tracking code. A few days more if you live within the EU. But for other countries (continents) it might take longer. Due to the ongoing pandemic packages get shipped via cargo ships instead of planes to the whole of America for example. I am not sure how it is with Asia or Australia but I expect the same.  I really chose the wrong year for this project 😅

Hello everyone!
I have good news. The Decks have been delivered to the Fulfilment center and are almost ready to ship. 😉
Unfortunately I need to clean up the exported addresses. The fulfilment center needs them in a very specific form which can not be provided by the Kickstarter export. For example street and house number need to be in separate fields, phone numbers shouldn't have special characters, names should be first & last name... Checking and fixing all this might take me another day or two. I will make sure to get it done as fast as possible.

Greetings!
I said I would close the surveys on the 20th. But my day job demanded a lot of extra attention the last days so I forgot to give another notice. But now for real. I will close the surveys in around 24 hours. So this is your last chance to fill it in if you didn't do it already and get the Decks as soon as possible. 😉
If you are not sure if you filled in your survey or not you can click on the "View survey" link at the top of the campaign page. It should look like this:

Is it already too late to wich you a happy new year? I don't think so. So - happy new year everyone! Let's hope this one isn't just a sequel of the dumpster fire 2020 has been for a lot of us.
On that note - let's begin this year with some good news. I got the confirmation from the printer that the decks should be ready by the 29th of January and get delivered to the fulfilment center on the week after (probably the 3rd of February). After the fulfilment company put the decks in stock the shipping can begin. For the backers living in the EU shipping should only take a few days. For other countries it might take longer. Especially since DHL decided to move smaller packages via ships and not planes around the globe. But I will get updates keep you updated on this of course. 😊

Hello everyone!
I know I did not post an update for a few weeks now. But that's simply because there is not much to tell you. The Decks are still in production. I also already signed the contract with the fulfilment company. So I am now in kind of a waiting mode. And I hate the feeling that I can't do anything to speed it up right now...
However... I mentioned that I might provide a voucher for everybody who wanted to gift the Deck of Dungeons on Christmas.  And after a couple of weeks of illness (yes, the virus-you-should-not-name) I finally came around to deliver on that. Here are two printable versions of the voucher. One with text and one without in case you want to add your own words. You can download them here:

Hey everyone,
I have a super short update for you. After some back and forth I got the color & sheet proof for the cards from the printer today. I am very happy with the quality and signed it off (Just need to send it back tomorrow). The printer is already paid which means that the full print run of 2000 decks (I still can't believe it...) should begin shortly.

updates.update_userinfo: Sending out those codes takes a bit longer
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone,
here is a small Monday update. At least I try to keep it small.
Digital Rewards
When you read the title you know whats up. Right after this update I will press the button to send out the digital reward to everyone who backed for it (5€ and 18€ tier) and whose pledge has been marked as collected. It will probably take 20-30 minutes until everybody got their mail.

updates.update_userinfo: Digital rewards will be sent out soon
updates.update_content:
And wow... did I underestimate the interest in this little project which started as a meditative hobby. I am incredible grateful and want to thank everyone of you. You kind of blew my mind 😄
Oh - I have one more surprise for you all. The printer didn't allow for 54 cards per deck. They only do 55 cards. So - you get one extra card. That's not the worst surprise I guess. And yes, the extra card is already done and will be included in the PDF as well. ;)
Next Steps

campaign.story:
Digital mockup, details not exact.




You own lots of dice . . . it's time to start playing with them!
Random Fun Generator, written by Sam Mitschke and Randy Scheunemann and illustrated by Len Peralta, includes over 20 new dice games, all of which can be played with standard six-sided dice.
Digital mockup, details not exact. Each game includes an illustration by Len Peralta! Sample pages are not 100% final and may change.


Random Fun Generator is a 76-page 7" x 10" B&W book that we're offering in both print and PDF. (Please note that print rewards are limited to U.S. backers only; we cannot ship any physical items to supporters outside the United States.) If you're on the hunt for more dice to add to your collection, we are making many of our custom dice sets available as add-ons (including some sets that have not yet been released) – see below.
Digital mockup, details not exact. More sample pages from Random Fun Generator! In addition to the rules, every game includes an example of play to make it easier to learn the games that are described in the book. Sample pages are not 100% final and may change.

Some of the games included in Random Fun Generator include:
 Great Rolled Ones – You and the other players are all cultists, attempting to summon Cthulhu and bring about the end of the world. 
 Leftovers – You and the other player are competing for points each round, but the player with the lowest total for the round gets to keep the leftovers as a bonus. Outwit your opponent and finish with the highest score!
 Participation Award – You and the other players must work together to defeat monsters, but you’re all a bit lazy and really don’t feel like working too hard.
 Liquid Courage - You and the other players are Dwarves. After centuries of peace, Dragons now threaten your way of life. Tunnel into long-forgotten mines to find the tools to help you survive the onslaught. With Dwarven beer to bolster your courage, only the bravest Dwarves will be celebrated as legendary heroes!
 Unreliable Flying Object - You and the other players are members of a spaceship crew, trying to return home. Your ship is pretty battered from the last mission, and things are constantly breaking, risking the lives of everyone aboard. Can you work together to keep the ship flying, or will you die in space?
 Six-Sided Slayers - In this cooperative game, you and the other players take on classic adventurer roles and charge deep into the monster’s lair. Kill enough monsters, and become legendary heroes! Fail too often, however, and you become a cautionary tale . . .
These plus another 20 games fill the pages of Random Fun Generator. Whether you play one as a filler between larger games or plan an entire evening of dice madness, Random Fun Generator has something for players of all ages!
Digital mockup, details not exact. Each game includes an illustration by Len Peralta! Sample pages are not 100% final and may change.

NOTE: Stretch goals only apply to the $35 and higher reward levels. The $6 PDF reward and the $15 and $31 print rewards do not benefit from unlocked stretch goals.  

Digital mockup, details not exact. Each game includes an illustration by Len Peralta! Sample pages are not 100% final and may change.
Some add-on items may be limited in the BackerKit survey. As always, the best way to secure the exact add-ons you want is by completing your survey early. Please email help@sjgames.com if you need assistance with your survey. 
NOTE: Add-on items are not available with the $6 PDF reward or the selection of No Reward. All add-ons are restricted to the print reward levels ($15, $35, and $75). To learn more about these dice, dice bags, and dice games, please see our online store, Warehouse 23.
Dice
The following are dice sets only – not complete games. You may use any of these six-sided dice to play the games included in the Random Fun Generator book.

Dice Bags
Our large drawstring dice bags are satin-lined and each is ready to carry more than 100 dice of varying shapes and sizes. 

Dice Games
These are ready-to-play dice games, some of which include standard six-sided dice that may be used to play any of the games in the Random Fun Generator. Games that use custom dice – like Zombie Dice and Cthulhu Dice – cannot be used with the Random Fun Generator. 

Other Games
These games are perfect for your next game night! 

 NOTE: United States street addresses only.
After the Kickstarter project closes, and after all pledges are collected, we will open the BackerKit pledge manager. There, you will tell us your Warehouse 23 email address, provide your physical address, and pay for shipping (if you are receiving physical rewards). See the FAQ for estimated shipping costs.
Failure to complete your BackerKit survey by the deadline (which will be announced in a Kickstarter update once the pledge manager opens) will result in a refund and removal from the project. We cannot allow projects to remain open forever; we must set firm deadlines so that we can properly close campaigns.
If you wish, you may choose to use a fulfillment service. This allows you to pledge for the project and then provide us with a U.S. address for delivery of your rewards. Forwarding from the fulfillment service, as well as any local fees, is your responsibility when using a fulfillment company.
INTERNATIONAL DELIVERY NOTE: No physical rewards are offered to international backers. If the project closes successfully, we will offer the Random Fun Generator book through Amazon's print-on-demand service*, which will make it cheaper for you to purchase the print books (shipping will cost a lot less).
We continue to search for reliable, economical solutions to international Kickstarter delivery.
* As a perfect-bound book, not a wire-bound title.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Steve Jackson Games is an established game publisher with a successful track record and we have enough Kickstarter experience to deal with issues should they arise. We have the book almost ready for print – we're working on the last round of proofing – and we will work with a printer who has done well for us in the past. To reduce the chance of delays, we are limiting physical rewards to U.S. only.

Now it's time for you to tell us whether or not to complete the project. As we've done in the past, we will stay in touch with our backers during and after the Kickstarter, all the way through fulfillment of the rewards.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Random Fun Generator 2 Update, New Buttons, and Illuminati Confirmed
updates.update_content:
Some big news came in over the weekend: Random Fun Generator 2 is officially out of the design/development/editing stage and now in layout. The majority of the artwork for the book is ready and we're getting closer to the day we can bring this second collection of dice games to Kickstarter. When? We don't have an exact date yet, but we'll definitely post an update to this campaign when we have an estimated launch date.
Steve Jackson Games Button Packs Now on Kickstarter
We've got a tiny campaign on Kickstarter to create two different packs of 1.25" round buttons. The project closes later this week and is your chance at both buttons to decorate your jacket or backpack and some of our newer dice. Don't miss the , the , or the game!

updates.update_userinfo: Random Fun Generator Shipping to Stores in August!
updates.update_content:
Thank you, everyone, for your support and for making this book a success. We're happy to report that Random Fun Generator is being released for distribution and retail sale in August . . . and to add that your first edition of the game includes more games than the retail release is going to have between the covers!
Changes between your book and the distribution release include:
No wire binding. The distribution release is saddle-stitched and has fewer pages.

updates.update_userinfo: Random Fun Generator 2 Update and Final Hours for the Illuminated Manuscript
updates.update_content:
As of yesterday, Sam and Randy have twenty different dice games for Random Fun Generator 2, the sequel to this project! We do not yet have a date for when Random Fun Generator 2 will launch on Kickstarter, but everything is moving in the right direction. In addition to the games, we also took a look at early concepts for the new artwork for the book; Sam roughs out ideas which we will send to Len Peralta when we're ready to move to the art and layout stage of the project.
While the team works on the new book, we would appreciate hearing from you about your favorite games in the original . So: Please comment on this update with the title of your favorite game in the book! If we find ourselves with more games than space, we'll use the info we collect here to influence which games, if any, are cut from the final manuscript.

updates.update_userinfo: You Like Dice? We Have Dice!
updates.update_content:
A couple of news items for today:
Work on Random Fun Generator 2 has officially started! Earlier this week, I sat in on a video meeting with Sam and Randy to discuss some of the new possible games and to play one of them. No solid schedule at the moment, but we're seeing some progress on the design and testing side.
We have launched a new pre-order store at BackerKit for dice, dice bags, and game accessories. This is also the place to order another print copy of the first Random Fun Generator book if you need extras to give out as gifts. There are several items listed: Check out the pre-order store today!

Thanks to the Warehouse 23 team (as well as our friends at PSI), we can report that the last of the print and dice rewards have shipped. Please watch for your print rewards to arrive just as soon as possible. If you spot an issue in your package, please contact help@sjgames.com for support.
For those of you who have asked where to find more dice, please see this page at Warehouse 23 for a list of our available dice, dice games, and accessories. The page changes as items sell-through and new releases are added, so the page may not look the same a month from now as it does today.

Two important bits of news today:
Physical rewards are still shipping! The Warehouse 23 team is packing and shipping rewards as fast as they can manage. We're a small team, and that combined with the social distancing rules we follow in the warehouse means that we can only ship so many packages each day. We will post an update when the last of the physical rewards have been shipped. (To accelerate the process, some of the rewards will be shipped from our primary fulfillment warehouse in Georgia.)
PDFs are being distributed through BackerKit, with Warehouse 23 distribution set to follow. The PDFs will take time to process, so please give us time to work through all of these files. Watch your email for the download link.

Earlier today, we started charging credit cards and locking BackerKit surveys. The books are in the final stages of printing and everything is on track for the Warehouse 23 team to start shipping the physical rewards later this month. 
As for the PDF reward, that is still on schedule to go out in December. 
A Sequel?

The time has come!
Random Fun Generator is off to print, and now we need to collect the necessary information to ship rewards for the future fulfillment process. Please check your email for a direct link to your Random Fun Generator survey (retrieval link)
BackerKit will guide you through the survey process. You may provide your Warehouse23 email address to save your PDF copy of Random Fun Generator. Than take a peek into the add-on store, and finally, provide any necessary shipping information for your order.
Survey Deadline

updates.update_userinfo: BackerKit Surveys Coming Next Week and News On Upcoming Dice Sets
updates.update_content:
First, the big news that you've all been waiting for: We're on track to open the BackerKit surveys by late next week! If everything proceeds as planned, we will launch the BackerKit smoke tests next Tuesday or Wednesday and then, if there are no problems, open the surveys on Thursday or Friday. Please keep in mind that some of the add-on options are limited, so please complete your survey as soon as it lands in your email.
There will be a survey completion deadline. We'll announce the deadline date next week once all surveys are live.

campaign.story: Mod has been prepared by Wojciech Gizynski
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
“Sleep Tight” has been tested with a big community of more than 500 testers worldwide. 
We received tons of feedback, we checked them all carefully, and polished all of the missing points.
Now the game is ready to be printed and shipped, all of the cards are done and all of the rules are written - the only thing we need is to hit the goal, print the game and bring it to your doorstep!
As soon as the campaign ends the printing and shipping process will start.
The only risk in our path is the delivery since delays could be applied due to external influences in some regions and countries. 
There will be other parties included like fulfillment agencies not controlled by us but offering a professional service.

DAMAGED PRODUCTS
As mentioned above, even when you give your maximum, external influences can get in the way. 
One such possibility is damage to products during the course of fulfillment. 
We will do our best to deliver the goods in perfect condition, and replacement of damaged games will be possible but please keep in mind that such replacements could be hard to do, depending on your location.
Please also keep in mind that minor cosmetic changes are not always damages.
In any case, The Moongrel will help you out!

NOT RESPONDING TO THE SURVEY (OR INCOMPLETE SURVEY)
This could result in a shipment delay for more than a few months. You will have enough time to complete the survey, so please make sure you do. Not completing the survey, or completing it after the final date we set could result in our inability to ship you the product, or applying the extra expenses. 

TERMS AND CONDITIONS
By backing “Sleep Tight” you acknowledge that the final product is subject to changes in it’s contents, design and packing.
If you fail to deliver the survey and your shipping address during 4 weeks after the survey starts you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you for the payment and donation in full. 
Further, if the survey is failed to be completed in 4 weeks after the project ends, shipping the product may carry additional expenses.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear all,
A hard and strange year is coming to an end and we all look forward for an amazing 2021. Of course at the moment that seems impossible but The Moongrel told me that 2021 will be a much better year for mankind than this one.

So he told me to wish you all a great Holiday and a much better 2021.
Let’s catch things that we missed in this year, opportunities that we lost but also let’s look back and see the best moments of this year.

campaign.story:
Latest Updates:
[18/09] Enjoy free demo of the Bosch Puzzle @ tabletopia now. Here is the link: https://tabletopia.com/games/bosch-puzzle  Please check the latest update #12 here for more.
[17/09] Fine Art archival prints available now. Escherian stairwell with Bosch Characters available in the form of a museum grade fine art print. Please check the latest update #11 here. 
[10/09] Mini deck e-proofs, linen cotton canvas prints, and another AR card done - please check the latest update #9 here. 
[09/09] Numbered seal unlocked and going to be there on each deck. Please check the latest update#8 here. 
[05/09] Try the Bosch Jigsaw Puzzle online now. Completely free to play, it is a pretty good mental workout while also giving you the opportunity to appreciate the art. Links below for 50 pcs & 120 pcs challenge:
https://im-a-puzzle.com/bosch_puzzle_deck_demo_50_pcs_8XTQy1KV.puzzle    (50 pieces)
https://im-a-puzzle.com/bosch_puzzle_deck_demo_6ipKAPlE.puzzle  (120 pieces)
[03/09] Collector's Edition deck as Kickstarter exclusive first print run & initiation of the proofing process. Check update#6 here for more. 
[01/09] Augmented Reality/AR experience available now.  Bosch mini deck, Uncut sheet etc. available as an add-on. Please check the add-on table below or update #5 here. 

Add-ons
ABOUT THE PROJECT
The Bosch collector's edition deck is inspired by & based on the works of the first surrealist painter in the world, modern artist Hieronymus Bosch (or known as Jheronimus Bosch and El Bosco in Spain). 
The BOSCH deck is much more than a set of playing cards. It is a work of art divided into 54 unique and individual pieces that bring an entire universe to life. As in the master’s works, all the corners of these cards hide carefully illustrated details for an impressive composition. Those who back the project will also receive an exclusive 55th card paying tribute to M.C. Escher where Bosch characters go up and down his impossible staircase, thus combining the style of both masters.
Close to one and a half years in the making, this is the one deck that I am most proud of.  Whether you are a playing card collector or a  puzzle lover or an art collector, this 100% custom deck has got something for each one of you. These art playing cards are my passion, but they'll never become a reality without your support. Won't you join me while we explore the world of Hieronymus Bosch?
Bosch Puzzle Playing Cards- Collector's Edition
FEATURES:
A transformation* deck of Playing Cards - basically the "Iron Man" of custom playing card design
54 piece Polyptych magical Puzzle 
Each card is a self-contained picture, but laying the cards out in a specific sequence transforms the entire deck into a single large artwork masterpiece. 
A Kickstarter exclusive 55th card that is the world's first masterpiece combining M.C. Escher's work with Hieronymus Bosch - Only available to backers of this project & this special card won't be available in the leftover decks, so you won't like to miss it. 
Reaching the funding goal will ensure a print run of 1000 decks. 
Printed by Legends Playing Card Company on Classic Finish with Performance Coating
Elegant tuckbox with strategic embossing  done on the artwork & matte soft touch stock
 Numbered seal on every deck. Check the update#8 for more. Handnumbering the tucks is also being considered as an option. 
Poker sized (3.5" X 2.5") & traditional cut
 Augmented Reality (AR) experience available (on Apple & Android devices)
Get this Collector's Edition deck at a discounted rate when you pledge on Kickstarter
Shipping & Fulfillment by Gamblers Warehouse, Texas, USA who are the leaders in Kickstarter fulfillment
 *A transformation playing card (sometimes referred to as a transformation deck when assembled into a complete set) is a type of playing card where an artist incorporates the pips of the non-face cards into an artistic design. 



A pic from the Prototype deck
The unreality of living in a COVID-19 world, an unprecedented experience that contradicts the reality we have known, is like living in a Bosch painting ... Particularly relevant today, however, are the people encapsulated in bubbles, remindful that we now live lockdown indoors, and outdoors with faces masked.- David Lenefsky, law.com
Augmented Reality 
The cards offer an Augmented Reality (AR) feature that will transport you back to the 15th Century artwork of Hieronymus Bosch. App available on both Apple & Android devices. See the demo below to know more:

The Inspiration
All of Hieronymus Bosch's seminal works were closely studied and explored for hundreds of hours. Bosch Playing Cards is a 100% original work of art that combines a number of Bosch's works in an entirely original manner.  This makes it a unique and art masterpiece, which is now available to all Kickstarter backers.
The Garden of Earthly Delights
The Temptation of St. Anthony
The Last Judgment
Ship of Fools

Puzzle & the Art
The polyptych puzzle playing cards is an ode to the legacy of Hieronymus Bosch.  Each card is an individual piece of art while placing the 54 cards together transforms these individual parts into a single larger masterpiece. 
The cards combine the essence of a transformation deck, in which the suits interact in the scene as elements integrated into it, with the nature of a puzzle deck, in which the dynamism of the characters is accentuated by their connection with those depicted in the other cards they are connected to. The Bosch deck is not only a deck of fine art playing cards, but it is a magical puzzle too. When placed together in the right sequence, the entire deck of 54 cards transforms itself into a single bigger masterpiece. A perfect gift for family gatherings & parties, I've even used it as a challenge to solve while in isolation during these COVID days. 
Are you ready to solve it in record time?  Check the online demo of the puzzle @ tabletopia here:  https://tabletopia.com/games/bosch-puzzle
Polyptych Puzzle incorporates 54 cards in a specific sequence to form a bigger masterpiece
Let pictures do the talking now.

The 55th card is a Kickstarter exclusive, available only to backers of this project.  The illustration on this card is inspired by one of the most renowned works by MC Escher, the Escherian Stairwell, but adds Hieronymus Bosch's special touch to it, thus making it an ode to both masters. Just as Escher reproduced one of Bosch's works in 1935, so the completely original artwork on this extra 55th card is an attempt to reproduce one of Escher's prolific works, through the lens of Bosch. Only available as the 55th card to the backers of this Kickstarter project. 
Kickstarter exclusive 55th Card - A tribute to M.C. Escher and Hieronymus Bosch
Kickstarter exclusive 55th card (enlarged) - Inspired by M.C. Escher and Hieronymus Bosch
Card back
Fine art tuckbox with matte finish and strategic placed embossed artwork
Tuckbox layout with embossed artwork in blue
 I spent hundreds of hours studying Bosch's paintings, and this helped me observe many small details in his work.  The following snapshots showcase some of those hidden details, which you will find reproduced in a completely original manner in this unique deck of cards.
Small details in Garden of Earthly Delights

ADD-ONS

Please check the following article on how to change your pledge amount to include add-ons.  https://help.kickstarter.com/hc/en-us/articles/115005126814-How-can-I-change-my-pledge-amount  Still have questions? --> guruplayingcards@gmail.com
Bosch Mini deck
Mini deck sized 44mm X 63 mm (approx. half of poker sized deck)
54 cards (52 + 2 jokers)
Linen Finish & printed by WJPC
Tuckbox with matte finish. Note that the tuckbox art is NSFW & different compared to the Collector's edition deck. Click here to see the tuckbox art for mini deck. 
Limited print run of ~500 decks (With only 250 mini decks available now)
 Numbered seal on every deck. Check the update#8 for more. Handnumbering the tucks is also being considered as an option. 
To add a Bosch mini deck to your pledge, increase your pledge by USD $10 (shipping included). You can add as many decks as you want. Please message me once you've added so that I can make a note as the supply is very limited.
Collector's Uncut Sheet
The Collector's Uncut Sheet is a great piece of art and a wonderful conversation starter. These authentic limited editions uncut sheets of playing cards will be pulled straight off the factory press. They will arrive ready to be framed on your wall and will be safely shipped in a sturdy round tube. To add uncut sheets to your pledge, increase your pledge by USD $44 (shipping included).
When initial renderings of the Bosch deck were shared, a backer of one of my previous Kickstarter projects posted comments along these lines: "This is the one painter that I would LOVE to own an original painting from!! Alas, so few known examples of his work exist, that I would have to have the money of a Russian oligarch IF one would ever come up for sale!  So instead I will have to settle for this great looking deck of cards!"
The uncut sheet will have 54 cards (and not the Kickstarter exclusive 55th card) due to the special print layout required for the uncut sheet. 
Mockup of the uncut sheet
To add uncut sheets to your pledge, increase your pledge by USD $44 (shipping included).
Fine Art Archival Prints
Introducing the museum grade archival prints....A conversation starter....
Using Archival pigment ink system & museum grade paper (315 GSM acid free paper)
After experimenting with glossy poster paper, linen canvas, poly-cotton canvas, and archival quality paper, I'm going with the archival quality museum-grade paper to produce one of the finest art prints available on Kickstarter. The minimum print run required at the printer is 10, and I will be taking the total number pledged on Kickstarter (and during the survey process) to keep the number limited. 
Please message me once you've added either or both the art prints. First come first serve. Note that international shipping is high for shipping a large poster. I didn't notice that while putting the uncut sheet, but glad that GW called it out when I enquired about the updated shipping quote with them.  This is the reason for the price difference between International & US backers.
Bosch Archival Print
Bosch Archival Print
Printed on museum grade Archival quality paper
Size: 61.4 cm X 57 cm
These will be shipped unframed in a  heavy-duty shipping tube via USPS
To add Bosch Archival Print to your pledge, increase your pledge by USD $90 (for US-based backers) & by USD $110 (for International backers)
Comes with a small GPCC logo and a digital signature
BoEscherian Stairwell Archival Print
A masterpiece that combines the works of two masters: Hieronymus Bosch and M.C. Escher.
Witness the characters painted by Bosch in Escherian stairwell
Printed on museum grade Archival quality paper
Size: 42 cm X 59.4 cm
These will be shipped unframed in a  heavy-duty shipping tube via USPS
To add Bosch Archival Print to your pledge, increase your pledge by USD $79 (for US-based backers) & by USD $99 (for International backers)
Please message me once you've added any of the fine art prints so that I can make a note. Do check the following article on how to change your pledge amount to include add-ons.  https://help.kickstarter.com/hc/en-us/articles/115005126814-How-can-I-change-my-pledge-amount 

Per the repeated requests, I am also making available two of my previous decks through this Kickstarter along with some gifts that you will love for sure. 
A Motley Pack Royal Edition
A full transformation deck 
56 unique cards with 100% custom and hand-drawn artwork
Premium Stock (Bee Casino Grade stock which is the highest quality card stock available @ United States Playing Card Company)
Embossed linen air cushion finish with performance coating
Poker Size (3.5" X 2.5")
52 Cards + 2 Jokers + 2 extra cards
Made in USA by the United States Playing Card Company (USPCC)
Every backer will receive On the Cards ebook & AR app experience

To add "A Motley Pack" deck to your pledge, increase your pledge by USD $17 (shipping included).
A Motley Pack - Royal Edition
Kalevala Playing Cards 
100% custom and hand-drawn artwork based on the Finnish epic Kalevala
Premium Stock (Bee Casino Grade stock which is the highest quality card stock available @ USPCC)
Embossed linen air cushion finish
Poker Size (3.5" X 2.5")
52 Cards + 2 Jokers + 1 extra card (with names of characters on court cards)
Custom tuck case with hand-drawn artwork
Made in USA by the United States Playing Card Company (USPCC)
Every backer will receive the exclusive Kalevala booklet (booklet size same as the size of poker sized deck)
This deck and a few other products are now part of the educational collection @ the National Museum of Finland.
To add "Kalevala" deck to your pledge, increase your pledge by USD $17 (shipping included).
Kalevala Playing Cards- Original Edition
STRETCH GOALS
Augmented Reality/AR experience.........(Stretch goal reached)
Numbered seal on tuckbox ......(Stretch goal reached)
Prints - Full sheet, 55th Card & Card back (Stretch goal reached)


The Bosch Collector's Edition deck will be printed by Legends Playing Card Co. (LPCC), and printed in Taiwan with their Classic Finish.  This is a softer and slicker paper, comparable in feel and handling to a Bicycle deck, but with a more durable card-stock.  USPCC is unable to print this deck with the given requirements, and LPCC is one of the few printers who can print this deck of the cards with the given layout for the uncut sheet layout, along with the full bleed artwork.

SHIPPING
Everything ships from the USA & I will be using the services of Gamblers Warehouse in Texas.  Shipping is automatically applied when you choose any reward tier and specify your country. You do not need to add anything extra. Avail discounted shipping prices when you pledge for any reward.  
USA backers - Free Shipping when you choose reward tiers of 6+ decks
International backers - Only $10 USD when you choose a reward tier of 1-5 decks
This is cheaper than the actual postage fees, so I'll pay the rest out of my own pocket to help you get Bosch in your hands. 
Given GW's expertise in fulfillment & shipping, I expect the fulfillment experience to be smooth similar to my past projects. The decks will be shipped from Legends factory in Taiwan to the USA and I am also absorbing some of those costs to get you an awesome deal when you back this deck on Kickstarter. That said, COVID has caused some disruption of shipping lines and I will be informing backers throughout the course of the project if any delay in shipping & fulfillment arises. 

 WHY PURCHASE ON KICKSTARTER? 
Funding is really critical for all independent creators like me. Join me to help push the playing card world forward. Transformation and such art decks are a rarity these days. 
The Collector's Edition has the Kickstarter exclusive 55th card that will be only available to the backers of this project and won't be there in the leftover decks. Once they're gone, they're gone! 
The addition of a free micro deck is also unprecedented and available to the backers for free and only for the first 48 hours of this campaign. 
 Unique discount, only for KS. Save money now by supporting the project. My previously produced decks are usually sold on Ebay at 5x-7x the price on Kickstarter. As an example, each card of A Motley Pack Transformation deck is sold for $24 each per card on Ebay. A few limited edition decks are not available anywhere. 
All discounted Kickstarter prices will be increased in retail stores once the project is over, which means Kickstarter is the only place you can get them first and at this price. The leftover decks will only have 54 cards, so you won't get the Kickstarter Exclusive card from the world of Escher & Bosch elsewhere except on eBay where you might find this deck at a highly inflated price. 
Help us spread the word via the “Share this project” button above. Share this with your friends and family now.
Kickstarter Exclusive FREE deck offer - Micro-sized Bosch deck [Offer unavailable from 24/08 01:31 AM AEST]
[Update: 01/09] - Micro deck has been upgraded to a mini deck & available as an add-on.
Kickstarter Exclusive micro Bosch deck available as a free gift to all Kickstarter backers pledging for at least 2 decks. The cards will be the same as the main Collector's edition deck while the tuckbox will be NSFW (Not safe for work). [Update 01/09] WJPC will be printing the mini deck while earlier MPC was slated to be the printer for the micro deck. Another creator helped me get a better quote with WJPC for the mini making it a printer of choice . Check this link for the tuckbox art:   https://www.instagram.com/p/CBQPeb6nTb8/
Specs:
Kickstarter exclusive FREE deck offer
Micro deck sized 32mm x 49mm 
54 cards (52 + 2 jokers)
Linen Finish
Tuckbox with matte finish. Note that the tuckbox art is NSFW & different compared to the Collector's edition deck. Click here to see the tuckbox art for micro deck. 
One free deck added to the Kickstarter reward of all backers who have got at least 2 decks as part of their pledge
Limited print run tied to the number of backers in the first 48 hours or if we reach the min print run of 500 decks
Only available for free during the first 48 hours* of this Kickstarter campaign
WHY KICKSTARTER
Kickstarter is a crowdfunding platform that helps bring creative projects to life. Think of Kickstarter as a place where you can help support a project like this and in return you are offered a series of rewards depending on your pledge. Once you've chosen what type of reward you would like to receive, Kickstarter will ask you to register in order to record your pledge. They will safely set up your payment but you will ONLY be billed at the end of the campaign IF this project reaches its funding goal. Remember, if the project isn't fully funded during our Kickstarter campaign, you won't be charged a dime (and, unfortunately, the decks won't be published). You can always go back and change or cancel your reward level before the campaign ends. You can check more info about it here.
With the funding goal achieved, I will be able to take the idea to production and get this beautifully crafted deck across to all of you out there. Let's make this project become a reality, and turn this into a published deck! Thank you!
ABOUT GPCC
The vision we have at GPCC is to pay tribute to the great artistic works of the past.  
My name is Sunish Chabba, and along with my friend & illustrator Ishan Trivedi, I am proud to introduce you to  "Bosch Playing Cards- Collector's Edition".
Guru Playing Card Company (aka GPCC) has already produced 7 successful kickstarter projects to date.  We have the unique accomplishment of having delivered premium quality products to backers across 25 countries, with the shortest lead time, all the while maintaining great communication with our backers at every phase of the Kickstarter campaign from to production to fulfillment.  I stand behind the production and delivery of the products shown above, and I am sure you will be delighted with the outcome. 
You can read more about GPCC here: Brand Spotlight: Guru Playing Card Company 
 In my life outside of GPCC, I work on digital projects.  But it means so much to have a tangible and crafted item in your hands to marvel at, and my goal in GPCC is to create exactly this kind of unique item for you.
KEEP IN TOUCH
Guru Playing Card Company on Instagram
Guru Playing Card Company Website
THANKS
Heartfelt thanks to United Cardists forum, BoardGameGeek reviewer EndersGame, Fes, Max Saiz, Colin Brady, Will Roya (playingcarddecks.com) & Lawrence Sullivan for their constant support & feedback. To Reetika without whose encouragement, this won't have been possible. To my previous Kickstarter backers who used to message me since 2019 on when will this be completed. 
Special thanks to Montenzi for his quick response to my questions. He is always willing and open to share both information & knowledge, a real asset to the design world. Thanks to Ben Jones from Elephant Playing Cards, because the Bosch deck started as an entirely different concept, but in the end became a polyptych puzzle. Ben had produced his Pipmen World deck a few years back, and as the Bosch deck is another polyptych puzzle-based deck of playing cards, a special thanks is due to him, since I took some inspiration from Ben's Pipmen World project for the mockups.

This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've successfully produced & fulfilled 7 projects on Kickstarter. All of these were delivered to backers way earlier than the estimated date & I am proud to say that my projects on Kickstarter have got one of the shortest lead times in this as well as the whole Games category as such on Kickstarter. This coupled with frequent communication through updates ensure that you as backers are on the journey towards making the project a reality. I'm confident that this project will be able to meet and/or exceed the expectations from backers similar to my past projects.

If there are any speed bumps during production, I will do my very best to communicate with you about what is going on and how I plan to resolve any issues. Risk mitigation while maintaining constant communication with the backers will be my strategy for this project as well. COVID-19 is the biggest risk for the printing, shipping and delivery section of this process, and therefore I have put a much later delivery date than I actually anticipate. Though I will likely be ready to start printing as soon as the Kickstarter ends, there is a likely chance of delays due to the nature of the beast there— in printing, but most especially in shipping.


The finished product may vary slightly from the art shown here. As it goes through the printing process, minor revisions may need to be made, and I will keep backers informed of such cases.

You, as a backer, are responsible for import duties, VAT or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities in your respective country as well as providing correct address information in the survey after the campaign has ended.

Thanks for visiting the project page. Please feel free to reach out to me for any questions.

-Sunish
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
