updates.update_content:
Hi All,
You have no idea how good a feeling it is to tell you that the first of you fine backers have reported receiving your decks & other rewards!

2+ years have gone into the creation, production & fulfillment of this project.  Fulfillment also has its own challenges but I am glad to share that all of your rewards are shipped out by GW from their Texas facility, and people are already sharing it being received.  If you haven't then you should be receiving it soon & I am always a message away (through Kickstarter or guruplayingcards@gmail.com).

Hi Everyone,

Seems like GW started sending the notifications after a day past the last KS update.  That said, a few of you who backed either a print or uncut sheet might not have received the tracking notification, even I've not, and I have reached out to GW to look into this. For all such backers, you will be recieving two packages, one with the decks, and another with the archival/art prints/uncut sheet in a hard tube.  

Also, I've provided the details of the 5 backers to GW who'd submitted their Kickstarter address survey a bit late after 24th April, and their packages should be dispatched within this week.

Hi All,

GW came back saying that the fulfillment has completed. I was looking forward to this, and very happy that you will be getting those decks and prints soon. 

As I didn't see any email tracking notifications going out (including me), I'd asked them about it and still waiting to hear back. Eddie did say that they will share the tracking numbers spreadhseet but sending those individually to everyone here will be challenging. I'm looking to put the email and tracking number on airtable or similar service so that you are able to search the tracking number for your given email address, but I am also pushing GW to see if they can send the automated tracking notification at their end as they usually do.

Hi All,

GW has advised that the fulfillment has started. Yay......I'm now looking forward to seeing the decks and prints/uncuts in your hands.  Note that GW does send an automated email with tracking details and so, please keep a lookout for their email. The email sender is usually "tracking@shipstation.com", you may want to whitelist this email address.

Hi All,

A short & sweet update as I could not share it earlier.

Fulfillment should start anytime soon, all details are with the Gamblers Warehouse @ Texas, and go ahead was already provided. Though they have been busy lately, and I am yet to hear on when they plan to ship but it can happen anytime soon.

Hi All,

A short update - Fulfillment hasn't started yet.  It has taken me some time to compile the address survey and run the numbers. I found a number of backers had accidentally answered the uncut sheet/replacement art print question in the survey even though they hadn't added it to the pledge. This resulted in getting me look at each record with a fine toothcomb.  Still working on it and once ready, will give the greenlight for GW to start the fulfillment. Hope it is understandable.

Hi All,

Good news at last!  The shipment of collector's edition decks have arrived at GW's fulfillment centre in Texas.  Phew.
With this, all products are now there with them. I will now go ahead and work on compiling the address survey data, and once the details are with them, they should be able to proceed with the fulfillment.

Hi All,

A short & sweet update. 

Lawrence (from Legends) confirmed that the shipment may reach GW by early next week. After that, I should be able to kickstart the shipping & fulfillment soon.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipment, Prints & AR app update - plus a demo that you can experience now itself
updates.update_content:
Hi All,
Hope you are doing good.
A few updates this time around :), Collector's edition deck shipment is there in US somewhere and might be reaching GW this week. Given the usual busyness at port and elsewhere, I am just keeping fingers crossed. It could be a week or two late but Lawrence is trying to follow up on that with the concerned team.

Hi All,

Here is the update on the shipment status & another news on Gamblers Warehouse's pause on operations after the storm. This is my first playing card project on kickstarter after many years that has seen a delay with respect to the earlier shipping estimate of Feb, and I am disappointed.

campaign.story:
The Next Cotta's Almanac Transformation Playing Cards
***
Introducing a precisely digitally hand-recreated reproduction of the next Cotta's almanac deck full of history continuing a year after the previous blue one, which was the first published complete transformation playing card deck in the world! 
The green "Andromaque" deck is the second in a series of six famous decks we plan to release in 2020...
The second transformation deck issued by Cotta is from 1806, following the remarkable success of the first almanac deck. This deck was also aimed to have well-known court cards, the interesting main character, and featured figures from classical antiquity, taken from sources such as Greek and Roman plays, as well as the Bible, which adds another historical value to its rarity.  
Original illustrations were fiddling artworks - manually stipple engraved & etched on copper plates
"Numbered" Limited Edition Displayed (Whole Metallic Gold-Inked Tuck)
There are many historical values in the series of decks! But if you are only interested in the deck details & images instead of history & backstory with additional description on the theme individually to each deck, then please skip about halfway down.
Charming beginning of "Karten Almanach" series
The story behind these playing cards, which probably conceal most of the world's playing card secrets, begins in Tübingen, a city in southwest Germany. 
The idea behind the concept of Cotta's transformation decks was to create a series of six decks on an annual basis from 1805-1811. Each deck would focus on a different theme, with the second set based on Racine's plays such as Andromache (1667), Britannicus (1669), Iphigénie (1674), and Esther (1689), which featured figures from the history of classical antiquity, Greek and Roman mythology, Bible, ...
Forming a "Card Almanac" (Karten Almanach), each card in the deck would represent one of the 52 weeks in a calendar year. At the time it was popular to print various almanacs, which were special pocketbooks for the new year, and often included a short poem or quote for each week of the calendar year. It was a logical move to connect each of these 52 weeks with playing cards.
 The famous Cotta's publishing house... 
Johann Friedrich Cotta
The friendship that gave birth to the idea of Cotta's transformation playing card almanac decks... 
Unexplained stories, hidden mysteries, secrets...
"Numbered" Limited Edition Displayed (Whole Metallic Gold-Inked Tuck)
It is especially significant for the way it displays meaningful and inspirational happenings from the time; in this second deck, the theme may reflect something of the religious climate of the day, also with assumed depictions from the life of noble families, etc...
Jean-Baptiste Racine (*December 22, 1639 - April 21, 1699)
Second almanac deck: "Andromache" (Year 1806) 
The images on the court cards are the "Greek and Roman mythology" characters mostly centered around the Trojan war and inspired by Jean Racine's plays such as Iphigénie, Esther, Britannicus and the "Andromaque" ("Andromache") which was first time performed on 17 November 1667 before the court of Louis XIV in the Louvre in the private chambers of the Queen, Marie Thérèse, by the royal company of actors, called "Les Grands Comédiens", with Thérèse Du Parc in the title role. Andromaque, as the third of Racine's plays, written at the age of 27, established its author's reputation as one of the great playwrights in France. 
*(We technically named this almanac deck the "Andromache" in its title for the main character "Andromaque" depicted as Queen of Spades, same as Joan of Arc was placed there on the Queen of Spades card in previous blue Cotta's deck themed on Joan.)
Around the time of Cotta's playing cards being produced, lots of creative people have found inspiration in Racine's playwrights. The composer André Grétry wrote a three-act opera, Andromaque, with a libretto based on the Racine play, which premiered in 1780. In addition, Rossini's two-act 1819 opera, Ermione, is based on Racine's play too.
"Numbered" Limited Edition Displayed (Whole Metallic Gold-Inked Tuck)
The central figure of Andromaque is depicted as the Queen of Spades, she is the wife of the Trojan military hero Hector, daughter of Eetion, and sister to Podes and six other brothers; her name Andromache represents "courage" and has a meaning of "man fighter". (And so she might be the most interesting "main" character of the second Cotta's almanac deck.)
Andromache was taken from her father's household by Hector and they together fit the Greek ideal of a happy and productive marriage, which heightens the tragedy of their shared misfortune. Andromache portrayed the role of perfect wife and mother who, a full year after the destruction of Troy, fulfills the fate of conquered Trojan women in ancient warfare as a widow held in captivity with her young son by Pyrrhus in Epirus, and later a distressed mother who despairs at the murder of her son Astyanax... 
Features:
Printed by USPCC on Classic Stock
Poker Size
Embossed Finish
52 Cards + 2 Extra Jokers + 2 Extra Collectible Cards
Metallic Ink On Box & Backs
Custom Seals - Numbered and Standard 
Puzzle Image on all Tuck Spines of the Series
Digitally Hand-Recreated and Designed by Azured Ox
Produced By Will Roya
Cotta's second deck was, as well as the first deck, designed by Countess Mary Day von Jennison-Walworth (sometimes spelled with a single 'n'). Her maiden name was Beauclerk, and she was the wife of Count Francis Jenison Walworth (1764–1824). She was an illegitimate (twin) child who led a very colorful life and finally settled down somewhat after marrying Count Francis in 1797. (Probably, she was creating illustrations in Stuttgart.)
2 Limited Editions
After the success of the first blue Cotta's almanac deck, to meet your demand, now we come with two versions of second green Cotta's deck limited edition - the "Numbered" and the "Standard". As a campaign before, we are limiting this 2nd "Numbered" deck to only 1,000 copies of tuck which is the whole gold-inked with custom numbered seals. Additional "Standard" limited edition decks are created just with a slight difference on tuck designed with dark and gold ink combination and the same custom seals (non-numbered).
The design of both versions of Cotta's limited edition tuck boxes, the standard and the numbered, created by Azured Ox, have been inspired by the old books and published writers work using the gold ink on their covers as well as combined with the dark ink.
With the Elements of Heraldic Achievement...
Includes heraldry symbols connected with the family and past of the noble designer countess Jenison von Walworth who created the most of the Cotta's decks...
The entire 6 deck series is in many ways designed by Azured Ox to meet collector's demand (as "collection of historical books") and will be produced with the piece of puzzle image on each tuck spine (left side of the box) to create together a nice display of the Tuebingen monument surroundings, where the idea for Cotta's decks was born.
Spine Puzzle Image of "Numbered" Limited Edition Displayed (Whole Metallic Gold-Inked Tuck) *Puzzle Image of "Standard" Limited Edition is Dark-Inked
 *(These are just "Digital Demonstrations" to present ink combinations of both editions)
*Puzzle Image of "Standard" Limited Edition Displayed (Combined Metallic Gold + Dark Inked Tuck)
"Numbered" Limited Edition Displayed (Whole Metallic Gold-Inked Tuck)
Six Unique Different Card Back Patterns Designed, with Regard to Card Handling, Individually for Each of the Cotta's Deck Year Almanacs.
Classic Style Borderless Full-Bleed Card Back Design with Luxury Feeling and Metallic Ink
The Same Gold Metallic Ink Card Back Design for Both Editions of the Cotta's Deck
The publisher's name was placed on the Ace of Clubs as follows: "A Tubinge chez J. G. Cotta, Libraire."
The transformations on the number cards have no reference to each other or to the court cards (as well lots of them might be considered as an unexplained mystery).
Classical, Historical, Mythological, Biblical...
The court cards were designated with the words "Valet", "Dame", and "Roi", which are the French terms corresponding to the Jack, Queen, and King.
There is evidence of Tübingen having a Jewish community in its past (e.g. the Middle Ages), but since catholic reforms were being enacted when this deck was being produced, this also may have been a motive for choosing illustrations that depicted classical and historical heroes and heroines mostly from Greek mythology, as well as the major roles from tragedies by French playwriter and dramatist Jean Racine, such as Andromaque, Iphigénie, Esther, and Britannicus.
Ahasuerus (King of Spades) is the Biblical name for Xerxes, the King of Persia who died in 465 BC. Other Biblical characters include Esther (Queen of Clubs), Xerxes' wife and Jewish heroine who rescued her nation from the evil Haman; and her uncle Mordecai (Jack of Hearts). Agrippina the Younger (Queen of Diamonds) was Nero's mother, while Sextus Afranius Burrus (Jack of Spades) was a Praetorian prefect, whom Agrippina helped to his position under Claudius and Nero.
Mythical characters include Andromache (Queen of Spades), the wife of Hector of Troy, described in the famous Iliad; Ulysses (King of Hearts), the Greek leader and hero from the Odyssey; Agamemnon (King of Diamonds), leader of the Greeks in the Trojan War; Iphigenia (Queen of Hearts), Agamemnon and Clytemnestra's daughter; Orestes (Jack of Diamonds), their son who kills his mother and her lover for murdering his father; Pyrrhus (King of Clubs), son of Achilles, who is put to death by Orestes; and Arcas (Jack of Clubs), son of Jupiter and Kalisto, who was a servant to Agamemnon.
Burrhus, tutor of Nero the Emperor, Agrippina was Nero's mother and she helped Burrhus on his position; 
Andromache, the wife of the Trojan military hero Hector, daughter of Eetion, and sister to Podes and six other brothers, she was held in captivity by Pyrrhus; 
Ahasuerus, King of Persia
 Mordecai, Uncle to Esther
In Greek mythology, Iphigenia was a daughter of King Agamemnon and Queen Clytemnestra, (and so sister of Orestes), and thus a princess of Mycenae.
Odysseus, Greek hero also known by the Latin variant Ulysses
Arcas, servant to Agamemnon
Esther (Queen of Persia) is described in all versions of the biblical Book of Esther as the Jewish queen of a Persian king Ahasuerus. In the narrative, Ahasuerus seeks a new wife after his queen, Vashti refuses to obey him, and Esther is chosen for her beauty. 
Neoptolemus, also called Pyrrhus, was the son of the warrior Achilles and the princess Deidamia in Greek mythology, and also the mythical progenitor of the ruling dynasty of the Molossians of ancient Epirus.
Orestes was the son of Clytemnestra and Agamemnon, (and so the brother of Iphigenia). He is the subject of several Ancient Greek plays and of various myths connected with his madness and purification, which retain obscure threads of much older ones. 
Agrippina, widow of Domitius Enobarbus father of Nero, & from the second marriage, widow of Emperor Claudius
In Greek mythology, Agamemnon was a king of Mycenae, the son, or grandson, of King Atreus and Queen Aerope of Mycenae, the brother of Menelaus, the husband of Clytemnestra and the father of Iphigenia, Electra or Laodike, Orestes and Chrysothemis. Legends make him the king of Mycenae or Argos, thought to be different names for the same area. When Menelaus's wife, Helen, was taken to Troy by Paris, Agamemnon commanded the united Greek armed forces in the ensuing Trojan War.
At last, we came with an idea to reflect the opposite of noble life and to bring closer to you even more of the unique artistic history placed on extra collectible playing cards...
Also, we thought it could be interesting to put other illustrations from the far past on the additional extra cards, in respect to year almanacs, we came with an idea of twelve calendar months in the series as an exclusive collection of unique historical artworks...
 An absolutely original playing card masterpiece to hang on your wall (double-sided)
With help from you the backers we plan to produce the entire 6 deck series! The color of each tuck box created by Azured Ox has been inspired by Goethe's experimental optic and color theory, since Goethe was an important contemporary of Cotta, along with Schiller. (Goethe's deepest immersion into colors was during Cotta's decks issuing.)
"Numbered" Limited Edition
"Standard" Limited Edition (Non-Numbered)
Add-Ons will be based on availability and will be announced after the campaign.  USPCC under printed Cotta #1 limited edition and we want to make sure we do not over sell the decks.    
Max Playing Cards
Worshipful Company of Makers of Playing Cards
World of Playing Cards

By PlayingCardDecks.com with a safe delivery guarantee and emailed tracking. International customers are responsible for any custom fees and taxes and will need to be very patient with delivery times as we are seeing some shipments take up to 4 months.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Artwork has been pre-approved by USPCC. Some small design elements may be subject to change based on backer feedback and printer recommendations.

Besides being a super backer, I have successfully completed and delivered several of my own campaigns as well as helping & collaborating with other creators.

I really enjoy the process of creating decks with the artists and working with backers to bring the decks to life. I am in a fortunate situation to be able to cover some of the costs of producing the decks but without the help of the Kickstarter community I would not be able to bring all of my projects to life. Creating these decks is a significant investment of time and money and I am grateful for any and all support.

If there are delays or issues they will be communicated and dealt with in an open manner. As always, I appreciate any feedback. You are welcome to reach out to me directly at any time and I will do my best to get back to you in a timely manner.

Back this project with confidence!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/playingcarddecks/cottas-almanac-3-transformation-playing-cards-reproduction

Merry xmas everyone!

All the rewards have shipped.  USA backers should receive by Jan 7 and international backers by the end of February.  If not please contact me and I can investigate.

Make sure to check out Cotta #3 campaign launching Jan 1:

Just wanted to update you that USPCC as notified me that the decks are complete and if they do not ship today, they should ship to me early next week. So I'm hoping to have them all shipped out by mid December. International customers please expect delays in transit.

We are then hoping to launch Cotta #3 by the end of the year & will give you a sneak peek of that campaign soon.

campaign.story:
ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE - 3D Printable Miniatures - STL files 3D Printable STL Miniatures and terrain for Role Playing Games, Tabletop, Wargames, or other RPG needs
IMPORTANT: This campaign is for a set of digital STL files, no physical products. Thank you very much for your interest in the project
ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE is my third Kickstarter, this project consists of a set of zombie-themed characters and terrains.
For only € 18 (65 for commercial license), you would have:
PACK ALL IN + STREACH GOALS + SPECIAL STREACH GOALS
All of this means 45 miniatures (including terrain pieces) and a diorama.
 The city is infested with zombies and monsters, work to survive this pitched battle. Unfortunately, the number of zombies is much greater than the number of survivors.
You will receive the digital files. These models are ideal for resin printers, but also suitable for FDM printers.
These characters can be used in wargame games or to make your own made-up campaigns.
All the characters have been modeled with the 3D modeling program Zbrush, I have been a digital modeler for 2 years, I had previously made collectible figures, you can see my previous works in the artstation link below.
https://www.artstation.com/ismaelpanaderogarcia
This kickstarter focuses on creating a world and characters inspired by the zombie theme, creative and memorable adventures that we can now produce in our fantasy role-playing games and board games.
If you love printing and collecting 3D printable figures and miniatures as much as I love sculpting them, this Kickstarter is definitely for you. With your support, we can unlock more and more figures and new stages.
The figures can be printed 1)complete with the base and 2)the base and the figure separated, for the more complex figures, it can also be printed in parts (you can see the example photo)
What will you receive?
Each figure has been exported as a high quality STL file. Also, you will have two options when printing each character, since the file will include a solid piece and other cut pieces, so you can print the whole character, or print it in pieces, the files are 100% scalable. The stl file of each character will be sent in two different sizes, 32mm, 54mm, as you can see in the photograph.
Products will be delivered 20 days after the end of the Kickstarter.
To show the expected level of detail, below is a sample gallery of prints made.
Here are the elastic targets for this campaign. Any new art will be featured here. Extended objectives will be incorporated into the basic objectives once they have been unlocked and will not have any additional cost. 
 AMAZON WARRIORS (16€ Basic License) (60€ Commercial License) Add-On 
€ 16 more if you want to receive the basic level of additional AMAZON WARRIORS (includes full delivery of stl files for all miniatures.By purchasing the base tier, you agree that both the digital files and the print versions of the AMAZON WARRIORS models cannot be sold commercially. You should not benefit from these models in any way.)
€ 60 more if you want to receive the commercial level (Commercial: License to sell the models. Includes full delivery of all stl files. By buying the commercial level, you accept that digital files cannot be shared or sold. Printed versions of the models AMAZON WARRIORS be sold at any store you want. Only physical products can be sold, not digital files.)
Click the image to see the Kikcstarter and all parts included
 Fantasy Miniatures Vol1 (10€ Basic License) (50€ Commercial License) Add-On 
€ 10 more if you want to receive the basic level of additional Fantasy miniatures Vol1 (includes full delivery of stl files for all miniatures.By purchasing the base tier, you agree that both the digital files and the print versions of the Fantasy miniatures Vol1 models cannot be sold commercially. You should not benefit from these models in any way.)
€ 50 more if you want to receive the commercial level (Commercial: License to sell the models. Includes full delivery of all stl files. By buying the commercial level, you accept that digital files cannot be shared or sold. Printed versions of the models Fantasy miniatures Vol1 be sold at any store you want. Only physical products can be sold, not digital files.)
Click the image to see the Kikcstarter and all parts included
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This project is for a set of STL files (digital files), so the risks are practically zero. All files are modeled and printed with Anycubic Photon 3D printer. The full package is finished before the Kickstarter launch so you can get your files as soon as the funds are released. The files will be available immediately after the kickstarter ends. Any problems that may arise with the models can be modified, updated and given to all sponsors.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The Graveyard Collection
This is a collection of graveyard themed terrain for your tabletop gaming pleasure. This KS is for STL files only. I have printed all the models and painted them to make sure everything is looking good! I used a Photon Zero and water washable resin to print all the models from"The Graveyard Collection". 
Thanks to all of you wonderful people my first two KS's were a success and hopefully this one will be too. 
Free Models
All the models I make end up being free to the community. I post them on My Mini Factory and Thingiverse. I also make them available on my Patreon. My first KS "Cult of the Abyss" is already available on my Patreon. Some of the "Cult of the Abyss" models are already making there way onto My Mini Factory and Thingiverse. So, if money is an issue, you will still be able get all the files. You will just have to wait a little longer.

campaign.story:
Welcome Travellers!
The Dwarves was a successful Kickstarter by Epics 'N' Stuffs. The original campaign can be viewed here - https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/epicsnstuffs/the-dwarves
Epics 'N' Stuffs is a DnD driven miniature patreon which creates a range of sculpts from varying parts of the lore with their own unique style.
We've had many requests for late pledges and merchant tiers, the original campaign also went beyond the final deliverables of 49 Models (including the base Dwarves and Stretch goals). This campaign will deliver those original assets committed plus additional variants/models as well as a Merchant tier facility. That's a lot of fully supported Dwarf models in 2 size variants.  ***This is a digital only Campaign***
The Assets in this bundle won't be offered again at this insane price so get it whilst you can!!!
 A BIG THANKS!!!
We'd also like to thank everyone in advance of their support, especially those who backed our original Dwarf campaign and our patrons over @ Epics 'N' Stuffs Patreon. Thanks to your support, and that of Kickstarter we've been able to offer the Dwarves from the original campaign PLUS MORE! to new people within the community. Thanks again, it means a lot.
Any Questions?
If you have any questions please refer to the FAQs at the bottom of the campaign page or alternatively DM us directly or email us over at epicsnstuffs@gmail.com
A couple of FREE .STL file's are available here to test print for yourself, it also includes a Chitubox file if you happen to be printing on a resin unit. 
 Toilet Paper Merchant - https://ln2.sync.com/dl/ab7ff7910/vy34g96p-fb7i98jv-93ahy2dk-hvpyp9z3
 Dwarven Rogue Variant 6 - https://ln2.sync.com/dl/73ebbe1b0/i3qirygq-5nvjfih7-ghj47jne-vmuj5sb2
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Here are the renders for each Dwarf and some images of print results .
Backers will receive the chitubox project files which contain the models hollowed and supported, the same files I used to print the models below. So if you have a resin machine such as the Elegoo Mars, Epax X1, Anycubic Photon etc... these files will just need slicing and should be ready to go :)
 Prints shown were made using an Elegoo Mars or Elegoo Mars Pro.

Additional variants for this campaign!
PATREON X KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE!
If you're a patreon backer over @ Epics 'N' Stuffs Patreon and happen to back either of the Dwarves Kickstarter campaigns you'll also get an additional model, the Dwarven Bannerman. All you need to do is either DM us or email us over at epicsnstuffs@gmail.com with your Kickstarter name and patron name/email. Once the campaign is over and everything has been processed/uploaded we'll send send you a direct link to the specific model. 
Upon a successful campaign/funding, Kickstarter takes 2 to 3 weeks to process pledges. Once that is done we will send everyone a direct message via kickstarter containing links/passwords to the library of assets for the campaign.
FAQs
Q, Why're you not offering physical tiers this time around?
A. There are a few factors, time investment being the main one, printing, prepping, boxing, sending all the models personally was a large 'time-sink'. Also with Covid it introduced consumable shortages and delivery delays which both financially kicked us as well as ate further into the time we could have been using to make the models. It's not to say we won't do another campaign in future with physical assets, just not this time around.
Q. Are the .STL's game size?
A. They're provided on 25mm and 32mm bases (some on 40mm and 50mm like the King). These sizes are typically bigger then your normal tabletop, they're a good size to paint and play. You can always scale them in your slicer to your desired size. I typically use this .STL to help with that - https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:3649454
Q. Can you not use 'insert service name here' instead of Sync?
A. Sync, despite it's flaws, proves to be the most reliable in our experience. We have used Dropbox in the past and ran into a plethora of issues including long outages, and hard daily limits. Sync has no daily download limit and the files will be hosted for an extremely long time. We have delivered these files to over 1000 people with great results. Any issues please ask and we'll aim to help :)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
None really,
The assets are all digital in this campaign and have already been delivered to a large number of people. Be sure you can utilize Sync (Try downloading and printing the test/free files). There are a lot of files to accommodate different sizes and requirements, so aiming to download everything in a large chunk is not advised.
We do however provide individual files for download as well as a huge .rar containing everything.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Epics 'N' Stuffs Shroomie Invasion! Going Live 31st October.
updates.update_content: HEY ALL!

So in todays post I'll be sharing some stats from the Kickstarter which I put together, most from when it comes to printing the physical pledges. I thought it might be cool to share :3
Also as requested by some, I'll be supplying a partial list of merchants of which to buy Epics 'N' Stuffs physical models from. So here we go :-

Total backers across both campaigns = 1,662

Hey all, I hope everyone is staying safe and having fun :3
Firstly thanks for all the kind words and comments regarding the campaigns, I've loved seeing some prints and paint jobs and  hearing some of the stories of how they're being utilised :)
We're always looking for feedback and ways to make our products better going forward but also being able to support the stuff we've already put out.

We've just added the project to Gumroad as well. Eligible backers have just got a direct message via Kickstarter (not email, we never send emails unless you contact us directly via email).
The message contains instructions on how t claim the Dwarves via Gumroad as an alternative to Sync/Dropbox.
Thanks again,

So just a quick heads up.
Dropbox has already reached it's limit so if you experience a 404 error with the dropbox link, it still exists it means its reached it's daily download limit and takes 24 hours to reset. We've ran into this before and it's one of the reasons we use Sync as they don't have a daily limit.
Dropbox's top plan (which we are on) allows 200GB's of downloads from the account in a day which is reached fairly sharpish. If you're desperate for the download and Dropbox is chucking out the error then use Sync.

campaign.story:
Casual Game Insider (CGI) is the premier magazine for casual board gamers. Released quarterly since 2012, we focus on the best casual games in the board gaming hobby and the community that surrounds them. These games are relatively easy to learn, quick to play, and accessible to all ages and backgrounds. We also feature a FREE print-and-play game in every issue! Check out some of our recent content:
As a reward for your pledge, we are offering several subscription options at the best prices you will find all year! Options include annual subscriptions in either print or PDF format, and lifetime subscriptions with an optional print upgrade. You can also add to your pledge to catch up on all 32 back issues! (Note: the covers shown below are for illustrative purposes only, as each subscription will include future magazines that have not yet been designed). 
Casual Game Insider has been made possible by the generous support of these awesome companies, and more. We are honored to have so many great people behind us. Thank you!
Are you interested in advertising in Casual Game Insider? Save up to $1,200 right now by pledging at one of our sponsor levels below. By doing so, you will be able to reserve ad spots in each magazine release over the coming year: Fall 2020 (October), Winter 2021 (January), Spring 2021 (April), and Summer 2021 (June/July).
Limited spots will be reserved on a first come, first served basis (according to the time each pledge is made). See our media kit for more information on ad choices or contact us at sales@CasualGameRevolution.com for additional questions. Ad materials for the Fall 2020 issue will be due August 3. Thank you for your support!
Would you like to customize an ad package to better suit your marketing needs and/or schedule? Please contact us to discuss!
The badge, banner, hand, price tag, and pricing images used on this page have been provided by Freepik.com. Seasonal icons provided by Flaticon.com.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
After eight years of production and fulfilling backer rewards, we are confident in our ability to deliver on our commitments. All of our releases over the past several years have printed and shipped on time to the full satisfaction of our backers — even during the COVID-19 pandemic! When any problems arise, such as lost shipments, we fix them immediately. We have a great team and a great quality printer producing this magazine.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Summer 2021 Issue Shipping Today! 10th Year Campaign Starts June 22
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone,
Our Summer 2021 issue has finished printing and is being shipped out today! (Please allow several weeks for shipping, as the USPS has been less reliable lately). The digital release is scheduled for June 22. We believe you will really enjoy this one. :)
This has been an incredible year. I would like to offer a huge thanks to all of you for allowing us to share our love of board gaming with you. We now are turning our attention to our 10th year (!) of publication. Our Kickstarter campaign launches in 1 week: Tuesday, June 22 at 9 AM Pacific Time. Click here to be notified when we launch. We hope you will join us for another year and spread the word to your friends!

Hi Everyone,
Just a quick update to let you know that our Fall 2020 issue has shipped! Print subscribers should receive their copies soon. Our digital release will be this Friday, October 2. You will receive a Kickstarter message with a link to download the PDF, as well as an email (release emails will be sent throughout the day).
We hope you enjoy it!

Hi Everyone! We have a few updates to share:
We just sent out our backer surveys to collect information for delivering your magazines (by mail and/or email). Please fill these out by September 1st to give us enough time to process our subscription lists. You can find the backer survey by logging into Kickstarter — you should see a banner at the top of the page that you can click on.
All of our content for the Fall 2020 issue has been finalized and we are currently in the graphic design phase. We have a ton of great articles and reviews coming your way — you're going to love it! I wish I could show you, but I don't want to give away any spoilers. :)

Thank you, thank you, thank you! We are so humbled by the support we have received from all of you, especially during this chaotic year. In return, we will do our best to bring excitement and positive energy to your life through the wonderful hobby of board gaming!
Here is our tentative schedule over the coming year:
After all pledges are collected: Back issue PDFs (for backers who pledged extra for this option)

updates.update_userinfo: The Final Stretch & an Early Reward
updates.update_content:
Wow! Thank you to everyone for such an amazing response to our campaign. We know these are difficult times for many people, and we greatly appreciate every dollar sent our way to help us continue to share our passion for board gaming.
If you're new to Casual Game Insider, we would also like to remind you that you can receive an early reward: PDFs of all 32 back issues, delivered as soon as the payments are processed by Kickstarter. These magazines took us 8 full years to produce, and contain a total of 1,700 pages and 325,000 words. To catch up on our back issues, all you need to do is increase your pledge by $50 (if you haven't done so already).

project_data.project_name: Casual Game Insider - Board Game Magazine (9th Year)

campaign.story:
Welcome to the Generic Universal RolePlaying System!
With GURPS, you can be anyone you want – an elf hero fighting for the forces of good, a shadowy femme fatale on a deep-cover mission, a futuristic swashbuckler carving up foes with a force sword in his hand and a beautiful woman by his side . . . or literally anything else! Thanks to its flexibility, quality writing, and ease of use, GURPS has been the premiere universal roleplaying game for over three decades! 
More than 1,500,000 copies are in print – not counting foreign editions. GURPS Lite, a 32-page distillation of the basic GURPS rules, is available for free download. We also have dozens of GURPS adventures and e-books available on Warehouse 23.
Whatever your favorite roleplaying genre might be, GURPS can handle it. More about GURPS . . . 
The GURPS team, under the direction of GURPS Line Editor Sean Punch, has prepared a dozen different PDFs . . . and this is your chance to possibly grab all twelve of the new PDFs for only $3!
Starting with the latest expansion to the GURPS Action series (see Warehouse 23), your pledge of $3 secures you a PDF copy of GURPS Action 6 - Tricked Out Rides. This 10-page PDF, written by Sean Punch, is a quick-and-dirty toolkit for adventures where sports cars pack more gadgetry than fighter jets, and miniguns fit behind headlights!

One new PDF is great, but the project gets more exciting for all of the backers as stretch goals are unlocked. With each unlocked stretch goal (see below), we'll add another one of the twelve new PDFs to your rewards . . . that $3 pledge becomes an even better deal as more backers join the campaign.
Please share this campaign with all of your friends!
Are you looking for an even better deal? Check out the $99 reward! In addition to the new PDF and all unlocked stretch goals, you will also receive $125 in credit to spend in BackerKit on GURPS PDFs of your choice. See the add-ons section, below, for more information.
NOTE: Only PDFs published by Steve Jackson Games and currently listed for sale on Warehouse 23 will be available to project supporters. We cannot list PDFs by other publishers or PDFs that we do not currently sell.
Do you want even more PDFs? During the BackerKit survey (see below), we will offer these -- and many more! -- PDFs as add-on items. You may increase your pledge by the listed amounts and then, in BackerKit, make your exact PDF choices. All PDFs will be delivered through both BackerKit and Warehouse 23, our online store.
While we will not immediately offer every GURPS PDF that is available at Warehouse 23 in the BackerKit survey, we will do our best to meet your requests. If, once the surveys open, you do not see your preferred selections, please email help@sjgames.com for support and the team will add your choices to the survey.
NOTE: Only PDFs published by Steve Jackson Games and currently listed for sale on Warehouse 23 will be available to project supporters. We cannot list PDFs by other publishers or PDFs that we do not currently sell.
For those of you who cannot wait for this campaign to be complete to get your hands on more PDFs, you can find the entire catalog of GURPS PDFs at both Warehouse 23 and DrivethruRPG. Remember, though, that choosing add-ons during this Kickstarter campaign helps push us closer and closer to unlocking the stretch goals. The more funds we can raise during the project, the better our chances of unlocking all twelve PDFs!
Can we unlock all twelve PDFs before the clock runs out?
PDFs will be delivered through both BackerKit (see below) and our online store, Warehouse 23. We encourage you to create a Warehouse 23 account if you do not already have one so that your PDFs can be added to your Warehouse 23 library.
Learn more about Warehouse 23 here!
This project offers only PDFs. There will be no print rewards, and no print add-ons, so that we can concentrate on delivering the PDFs as fast as possible. This means no printed books, no dice, and nothing that would require shipping physical items. PDFs only!
BackerKit Surveys
We will be using BackerKit to collect email addresses and manage any add-on choices that you may make, and failure to complete your survey will mean that you will not be able to download your rewards. We will post an update when the BackerKit surveys have opened and, at that time, we will post the survey deadline date.
Once the Kickstarter campaign is over and all rewards have been delivered, the PDFs unlocked during this project will be released on Warehouse 23. At that time, each will be priced as individual titles; the special price of all unlocked PDFs for only $3 will only be available in this campaign.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Steve Jackson Games is an established game publisher with a successful track record and we have enough Kickstarter experience to deal with issues should they arise. All twelve PDFs have been completed, and now is your chance to unlock stretch goals and make the rewards package more valuable for every backer!

As we've done in the past, we will stay in touch with you during and after the Kickstarter, all the way through fulfillment of the rewards.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: GURPS Pyramid Scheme Article and Reward Info, Project Launches on Monday.
updates.update_content:
On Monday, we're launching the GURPS Pyramid Scheme here on Kickstarter! Three new Pyramid issues -- one each for fantasy, modern, and future players and GMs -- every one of which expands in size as project stretch goals are unlocked. To better prepare you for the new campaign, we've now shared the article listings (both starting articles and stretch goal articles) for each issue:
Fantasy/Magic I article list
Modern/Action 1 article list

For those of you who have been asking about a second GURPS PDF Challenge, we're ready to announce that Steve Jackson Games' GURPS Pyramid Scheme is almost ready for Kickstarter launch. While not an exact copy of the approach used for the PDF Challenge that all of you supported earlier this year, the GURPS Pyramid Scheme campaign means more GURPS support for fantasy, modern, and sci-fi games.

Thank you, everyone, for your support of this campaign! As of earlier today, the last of the Warehouse 23 files have been distributed, shifting this project officially into the complete column. We could not have done this without all of you!
What's next for GURPS? Sean and the team are working on several new releases, and we have plans to take what we have learned from this PDF challenge and try something new in the future. Please follow the Warehouse 23 Kickstarter account for email notification when we launch a new project.

The Warehouse 23 fulfillment process has started! This will be done in stages and as quick as we can manage, but it will definitely take some time to get everyone's PDFs added to their Warehouse 23 accounts. Please hold off on contacting the team with project questions; we will post another update here once Warehouse 23 fulfillment is complete. 
How long will this take? Unknown. Darryll started the process earlier today and it is going to take weeks, possibly several weeks, to wrap up this stage of the project. We're still on track to complete the campaign by the estimated delivery date, and possibly sooner than that.

Thank you to everyone who has wrapped up your surveys! 
For those of you who have not yet completed your surveys, please remember that these must be finished by the end of August. At the end of the month, we will issue refunds for any incomplete surveys and you will be removed from this project. 
PDF Rewards

After a fairly smooth smoke test, we decided to open the doors so we can start the survey and delivery process. 
When will I get my PDFs?
PDF Purchases will be distributed periodically via Backerkit. After you complete your survey, it may take up to 7 days for you to receive download links in BackerKit.

Hey folks!
Moments ago I flipped the necessary switch to begin the Smoke Test for the GURPS 2020 PDF Challenge! Approximately 150 of you will be randomly selected across the various pledge levels to complete your surveys and collect your PDFs. We need your help to make sure that the whole BackerKit can roll out soon! 
As this is our first all-digital BackerKit, I expect to have some speed bumps that might need to be smoothed over. A lot of behind the scenes work was done to load in physical variants where possible for many of the GURPS items. If you see a physical item available, drop me a line directly via e-mail to (Darryll@SJGames.com). This goes for any oddities you might come across.

We've crossed the finish line with more than $57,000 in pledges. You didn't just unlock all 12 PDFs (remember when $45,000 seemed far off?) - you kept on going. Thank you for your support! 

More impressive is that when I say "you," I'm talking about more than 2,700 backers. That's . . . staggering. It's a big vote of confidence for short PDFs (at least some of the time!), future Kickstarters like this one, and GURPS. 

Again: Thank you. And thanks to Phil Reed for orchestrating everything, Steve Jackson for encouraging us to run with it, our writers, Steven Marsh for matching those writers with topics and art, and Nikki Vrtis for laying out a dozen PDFs in no time flat. It was a team effort in every sense!

- Sean "Dr. Kromm" Punch

campaign.story:
Black It Out is a fun roll and write game that is extremely simple yet offers great tactical decisions.
Playing in roughly 15 minutes (with no set up time) Black It Out is ideal for families, as a warm up at the start of a games night or as a 'one last game' before the night is over. 
The aim of the game is to be the person who has 'blacked out' the most of their grid.
On a turn you will roll three dice, total two of them which will give you a shape and then draw that shape on to your grid to 'black it out'!
The grid you will try to black out and some examples of the shapes
You will repeat this over 20 rounds and see who can 'black out' the most of their grid.
The round tracker
It's quick, simple and can be played by almost everyone. It has been especially designed so that players can play remotely and with their whole families.
Fun for all the family
To play you will need to provide 3 of your own 6 sided dice (these will not come as part of the kickstarter).
Works well playing remotely with friends
The base pledge will come with two different player sheets. This means that different numbers on the dice will be valuable to different players and adds an element of variety and replayability.
The advance pledge comes with an additional two player sheets - giving you four sheets in total. These sheets add an optional rule that adds more player interaction while ramping up the variety. It can still be played remotely but works even better in person! You will need access to more dice to play the optional rules (the exact total depends on the number of players). The new sheets will add different shapes and can still be played in combination with the base game sheets.
Once the game has been funded and I have received the money from Kickstarter I will distribute the game as PDFs. 
£500 Stretch Goal: unlocked! 
Due to the awesome support so far, I have decided to add a stretch goal. If we can make it to £500 pledged I will add an extra player sheet for every backer!
That will mean that everyone will be getting either 3 or 5 sheets depending on the your backer level!
More sheets = more variety = more fun!
£600 stretch goal: 
 Well we smashed the £500 goal so it‘s time to unlock another player sheet but this time just for the backers at the £2 or higher pledge level (the ‘base and advanced level’). This will means that if you’ve backed at that level you will be getting 6 sheets! 
£750 stretch goal:
A reformatting of the player sheets to allow more sheets on each page you print! This will result in easier storage and portability whilst maintaining the ease of play. 
Thanks for backing Black It Out!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The risks are minimal. The game is created and other than some formatting tweaks is ready to go. The only issue I can foresee is a delay in sending the game out if the funding is delayed for any reason.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Upgraded game, general updates and thank you
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone, 
This is going to be a slightly longer update again but it is full of lots of useful information so please read it. 
Upgrade
As you know we've been working on a updated ruleset but we've also been working on a lot more than just that. Over the last couple of weeks I have seen people online redesigning the game to make it easier to show the shapes in different orientations. So we have heard you and have created a format to allow you to do just that. We have separated the grids and the shapes so you can rotate the paper that the shapes are on to help you picture what they would look like on your grid.

Hi everyone,
I hope this update finds you healthy and happy. This is a fairly long update but full of lots of useful information.
Fulfilment
I have sent out the game to everyone I can. If you haven't got the game yet then one of a few things may have happened. Firstly, it may have gone to your junk folder so please check there. Secondly, I may have had an issue with your email address (both the one for Kickstarter and the one you supplied in the survey) - if I know about this then I have sent you a message through Kickstarter. Lastly, there may be an unknown reason why you haven't got it. I have checked my emails and think I have got the game to everyone but if you haven't got it please let me know by emailing me at greengambitgames@gmail.com.

Hi everyone, In the last couple of days I’ve sent out the surveys for everyone to fill out. These should have come through to your emails so please check and if there’s a problem let me know. The surveys are there to let me know which email address you would like the game sent to and if you would like the rules in all of the additional languages. When it comes to the email, you will receive you either 3 or 4 attachments : 1) Standard game sheets and rules (2 page pdf) 2) Advanced games sheets and rules (2 page pdf) 3) Kickstarter exclusive game sheets (1 page pdf) 4) Foreign language rules (still being formatted but probably a 2 page pdf) The foreign language rules will all be together so don’t worry about letting me know which language you would like. I have had a couple of questions about the foreign rules so I hope this clears it up for everyone. If it doesn’t or it triggers any more questions please message me so I can try and help! I am hoping that I should be able to get the game to everyone by mid July but I’ll keep you updated with this and try and get a more exact date to you soon. Thank you for your on going support. Happy gaming, Seb

It’s taken a couple of hours to get my head around what’s happened over the last three week.
What you have helped me achieve is simply amazing!
I just want to say a huge thank you. A huge, massive enormous thank you! I mean that from the bottom of my heart. Throughout this campaign you have all been fantastic- not only by backing the game but also by all the positive comments I have received and helping spread the word about the project.

Happy Friday everyone, I can’t believe how fast the last two weeks have gone. It still amazes me how much you have helped me achieve so far. We have slightly less than a week to go and are so close to our last stretch goal.
Over the last couple of days we broke through the ‘£600 for 6’ stretch goal so now everyone who has backed at £2 or more will be receiving 6 player sheets - two base, two advance and then 2 from the unlocked stretch goals! This only leaves the last goal! At £750 I will be reformatting the player sheets to separate the rules and ‘play area’ to make printing, playing and storage easier.

campaign.story:
In Sleep Tight you are kids stuck in a very special dream...a dream where the Sandman lives. Your souls have been shattered, and the only way to wake up is to collect Soul Fragments by traversing your nightmares. But watch out, because the Sandman will haunt you trying to consume your remaining Soul Fragments.
Team up against the Sandman or turn against each other. If the Sandman is killed, everyone wins. But if one of you wakes up first, they win, while the other players stay trapped in the nightmare forever, left as a feast for the Sandman.
Try this game of cooperation, conflict, betrayal, and nightmares 
WHAT IS SPECIAL ABOUT SLEEP TIGHT
Sleep Tight is a game with a unique atmosphere and fast and dynamic gameplay. We played a lot of board games, card games and tons of RPGs and wanted to create an easy to learn game that relies on a universal language (uses just symbols and icons for all actions - which are easy to learn). The game is also full of tactics and options and demands a mastering of the possibilities and choices as it can be a game of cooperation, individual play, or backstabbing while you play as the Sandman’s undercover ally.
Easy to learn and easy to dive in mechanics even for inexperienced players
  Card use easy to learn and accessible symbols
  A dynamic, fast, and intense system
  The game is for 2-4 players
HOW TO PLAY SLEEP TIGHT
Sleep Tight is a 10-20 minute game that is dynamic and fast-paced in terms of decisions and actions. Sometimes you’re lucky and get a large hand of cards you can choose from, and sometimes you have to micromanage and get the best out of a small hand. It’s a game where your luck can change suddenly when the Sandman lashes out, testing your intuition and skills. Will you hide and wait for the attack to blow over, or will you actively attack and escape by the skin of your teeth?
In Sleep Tight you need to constantly be alert and think few steps ahead, as you will need to guess the other players’ next move or even worse, the Sandman’s!

 A video of the gameplay can be seen here: 
WHY KICKSTARTING A PRINT TO PLAY VERSION
This is a sort of a pre-campaign; we would like to polish the rules to their perfection and what better community to do that than the Kickstarter gaming army? Also, Kickstarter is a good way of spreading the word about the game. This is our first game and making waves in the sea of games is hard, but we thought; “Hey, if we show our game to players and they happen to like it then we are all happy.”
We want to get in touch with you and hear your experiences in playing “Sleep Tight” to improve the game and shortcomings we could have missed during tons of playtesting we conducted!
 WHAT DO YOU GET?
After the campaign ends you will get the essentials to play the game; Print To Play PDF version of cards and the rulebook.
“Sleep Tight” currently includes:
96 cards (more than 40 unique cards)
  A PDF Rulebook
  A survey for your comments that we will happily read
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The game is ready; the files are uploaded on the server, waiting for the campaign to reach its goal to be downloadable. We playtested the game with friends, enemies, family, strangers, happy people, sad people, and we feel confident that you will like it.
The main goal of this campaign is to hear the voice of the players, their eventual suggestions, comments, critique or praise, and to spread the word about “Sleep Tight”.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Please click the image to gain access to the late pledge options.
Tiny Epic Pirates is a 45 minute, 1-4 player game of high-seas adventure, utilizing a variable RONDEL action system and action combo-ing!
Every player's Rondel is unique, every game!
In Tiny Epic Pirates you take control of a Pirate ship with the goal of burying vast amounts of wealth on secret island hideaways.
Each turn, you move your Captain Token around your ship’s action wheel, selecting which action to perform...
It isn't just other pirates standing in your way of burying treasures! The Royal Navy has their eye on you and the more notorious you become, the more eager they are to stopping your exploits. 
An encounter with the Navy will surely slow your progress, so you best be avoiding them. To do so, you're going to need a good ship and a great crew!
There's a lot of scallywags out there looking for adventure! So assembling your crew won't be very hard, but pulling together a winning crew... that's a different story.
Your crew will play a major role in Tiny Epic Pirates. Each crew member brings different advantages to battle and to the actions you'll take. 
The dice listed at the top of each crew card, and your captain's card, represent what number you'll need to roll to score a hit on another ship! Having multiples of a single number can result in lots of damage, but spreading your numbers out can result in more consistent results. The choice is yours!
The icons listed at the bottom of each crew card, and your captain's card, represent bonus actions that can chain together for epic turns! If the first icon matches your chosen action, you'll get to take the action of the second icon for free.
In addition to your crew, you'll have your reputation and your exploits. As you prove yourself in battle, your legend will grow and so will your ability to command your ship.
Winning battles against other pirates, and against notable merchants, will increase your Legend Level. Each new level offers immediate benefits, as well as increases to your ship's movement and the number of dice you roll in battle.
But enough talk, you're no landlubber. You can learn more about Tiny Epic Pirates by engaging with us in the comments, watching the videos below, or by downloading the rulebook below.
This image is updated to reflect unlocked stretch goals
Includes 7 Plastic Ship Minis!
When you pledge for a Deluxe copy of Tiny Epic Pirates, you will receive the base game PLUS the Deluxe components shown below.
This image is updated to reflect unlocked stretch goals.
Deluxe Content: Crimson Silver Mini Expansion
The Crimson Silver Mini Expansion introduces new Floating Fortresses and Silver as a new resource!
Players are able to visit the Floating Fortresses as they move around the board and perform upgraded versions of Trade, Plunder, and Crew Up. Players may also lay siege to these Fortresses for additional rewards. But beware, the Floating Fortresses have a contract with the Royal Navy and if any Pirates show their dirty face around there, the Navy will be on their tail!
Even with the threat of the Navy though, the precious Silver these markets are known for is simply too alluring to avoid. A lot of blood as been spilled over this Silver. So much that it's known around these seas as Crimson Silver.
***Kickstarter-Limited Exclusivity - Deluxe content will not enter regular distribution. However, it will be available in limited supply at conventions, through contests, online at the BGG promo store, and directly from Gamelyn Games on our website or through our Amazon store.
In Tiny Epic Pirates: Curse of Amdiak, rumors of the unthinkable are spreading quickly around the islands. Rumors of dead pirates returning to the sea... aboard an ominous ghost ship helmed by the legendary pirate Amdiak...
Several new game elements are added to play including cursed gold, a ghost ship that haunts the players as they try to steal the cursed gold, ancient relics, haunted map cards and even skeleton crew!
Players gain cursed gold by stealing it from the ghost ship and attacking other pirates who possess it. Cursed gold can be traded for an ancient relic said to hold ashes of Amdiak. Bury this relic and break the Curse of Amdiak!
If the ghost ship finds catches you though, your captain becomes cursed and you lose your cursed gold. Once cursed you will be able to recruit powerful skeleton crew to mindlessly obey your wicked command!
Do you dare to set sail on ghostly waters?
The Curse of Amdiak expansion will come in a box of the same thickness and quality of Tiny Epic Pirates. It will share the same width and height as well. Making them great for storing side by side!
The Curse of Amdiak expansion is available in the 'All-In Deluxe' reward tier or as an add-on in the pledge manager service after the project.
Additional Add-Ons 
Download the prototype rulebook below! These are prototype rules and have not been edited for final production. This is not an exact reflection of the final rulebook.
Click to download.

Please share this project with as many people as possible to help us achieve these goals and thank you for all the support!

All Tiny Epic Pirates games and Tiny Epic Pirates accessories will be US-Customs Friendly, CA-Customs Friendly, UK-Customs Friendly, EU-Customs Friendly, AU-Customs Friendly, and NZ-Customs Friendly.

Therefore if you live in any of these regions and have any additional charges for receiving your package for Tiny Epic Pirates, simply email info@gamelyngames.com with a copy of your customs receipt and we will reimburse you via PayPal. A small PayPal fee will apply and will not be reimbursed.
Shipping Costs
Every backer is important to us, regardless of location, but the reality is that shipping is very expensive and is a cost we all need to share. To offset this, while remaining fiscally responsible, we have included a small discount for ALL shipping, but no shipping is free.

The 6 design goals of a Tiny Epic game!
"Tiny Epic" is an exclusive series of small box games produced by Gamelyn Games and designed by Scott Almes.
Each game in the series is entirely unique but strictly adheres to two core values: TINY and EPIC!
• TINY being the small box used for each game AND the simple, easy to understand, set of rules each possesses.
• EPIC being their surprisingly gratifying gameplay. Each is packed with meaningful decisions, layered strategy, and high replayability, traits not typically found in games this size.
To learn more about the series, please visit us online.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The publication of a board game is a highly involved process. It can be prone to many mistakes and delays, even for experienced publishers.

We are proud to say that we're prepared for the task at hand and have years of experience in successfully producing board games and fulfilling Kickstarter projects.

Here are the steps we take to prepare and reduce the likelihood of mistakes and delays:

1. We have done significant pre-production. This includes having all the illustrations for the game complete and the graphic art over 95% complete. The production quote is in hand and ready to be initiated.

2. We are working with an experienced manufacturing partner. We are familiar with their production requirements, timelines, payment schedules, communication methods and Chinese freight arrangements and costs for when it comes time for shipping. We will provide tracking information for the boat when the games leave China.

3. We are working with an experienced fulfillment partner. We are confident that they can handle any amount of work we send their way. They have fulfilled many projects and have proven to be communicative, punctual and respectful when dealing with our customers.

Above all, I am 100% dedicated to backer communication. I will be transparent with our process and involve our backers as much as possible. I will be present daily during the project to answer any questions and I read every comment. I will provide regular updates and supply photos of the progress.

Thank you for your trust in us! Let's bring Tiny Epic Pirates to game tables around the world!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: HONORARY PRODUCER
support.descp:
You will receive an ADVANCE copy of the Deluxe Version of Tiny Epic Pirates - including all stretch goals and the ***Kickstarter Limited Exclusive Deluxe Content. You will also receive an an ADVANCE copy of the Curse of Amdiak Expansion.
This copy of Tiny Epic Pirates is among the first of the entire production and is air-shipped to Gamelyn Games prior to the production being shipped overseas. You will be one of the very first people to own Tiny Epic Pirates!
With it you will receive an Honorary Producer Certificate autographed by Scott Almes, Felix Wermke and Michael Coe.

You will also be credited as Honorary Producer in the rulebook.

You will also receive a print-on-demand physical copy of Tiny Epic Pirates using the Premium Print 'N Play files in September 2020.
You may add extra copies of Tiny Epic Pirates to your order that will be delivered with the rest of the project fulfillment in March 2021 (estimated ETA).
INCLUDES:
Advance Deluxe Tiny Epic Pirates
Advance Curse of Amdiak Expansion
Premium Print & Play Files
Print-On-Demand Tiny Epic Pirates Premium Prototype
Autographed Tiny Epic Pirates Certificate
Rulebook Credit - Honorary Producer

updates.update_userinfo: *THIS UPDATE CONTAINS INFORMATION ON HOW TO REDEEM MISSING REWARDS*
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,
I'm proud to announce that our fulfillment teams have completed shipping for the rewards of Tiny Epic Pirates!
Thank you all for your amazing support for this project.
That's a wrap!
As of April 29th, 2021 we have successfully picked, packed, and shipped all reward packages for Tiny Epic Pirates.

Hello everyone,
It is the end of March and while we were able to fulfill many of your games, we were not able to complete fulfillment entirely, like we had planned. For this I apologize. 
Here is our current scenario regarding fulfillment. 
Fulfillment Update

updates.update_userinfo: Rewards to begin shipping this week! Complete Fulfillment By End of Month.
updates.update_content:
YARRRR!
Great news!!! Tiny Epic Pirates will be on your game tables soon!
It's March and you know what that means!! Time to play Tiny Epic Pirates!
As a reminder, we will be fulfilling the project from 3 different hubs. We will fulfill from the and the . While fulfillment will begin on different dates for each hub, all backer rewards are scheduled to be shipped out by the end of March. Find the heading below that matches your country for more details on the shipping timeline.

updates.update_userinfo: Games in route to fulfillment centers + Tiny Epic Dungeons!
updates.update_content:
Hello awesome backers!
I have two exciting pieces of news today.
1. The vessel Xin Tai Cang carrying Tiny Epic Pirates has arrived and unloaded in North America. We have our train and truck routes booked for an on time arrival to our warehouse in Indianapolis.

updates.update_userinfo: Track the Pirates' Vessel! ETA: Next Month!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!
Great news!! The games made it out of China before the Chinese New Year! We're getting so close now!!
While it is always a good thing to depart before CNY if you're up against it, it was particularly the case this year because of a shortage of vessels and routes. Due to the Pandemic, ocean freight has reduced and made things a lot tighter for everyone. Even though we had our shipment booked in advance, it kept getting pushed back. This became worrisome when we were told that our new departure date was the last chance to leave before CNY. Fortunately, we were able to make it out on that date and is sailing on the high seas as we speak. :)

Hello everyone,
Happy new year! I hope you all had a safe and good holiday. I have some good news to share, so let's jump right in.

Production & Fulfillment

updates.update_userinfo: Production Proof Unboxing + ETA still March 2021!
updates.update_content:
Hello backers,

This will be a rather short update but a good one! 

We've received the production proof copies of Tiny Epic Pirates, the deluxe content and the Curse of Amdiak expansion and they look fantastic!!!

Ahoy my friends!
